session_name: Beyond One Database : A Practical Guide to PolyStorage Architectures
description: As enterprises scale and AI becomes ubiquitous, traditional single-model databases fall short. This session explores Poly Storage architectures—the intelligent integration of relational, document, graph, and vector databases to optimize modern data ecosystems. Attendees will learn to evaluate each model's strengths, design composable architectures for scalability and performance, and avoid common pitfalls. We'll also highlight real-world use cases like semantic search, personalization, and responsible data representation.

session_name: Beyond Statistical Significance: Designing Robust AB Tests
description: Learn how to design robust A/B tests that are both statistically sound and practically meaningful. Manisha Arora, Data Science Lead at Google and Banani Mohapatra, Data Science Manager at Walmart will talk about how to set a good hypothesis, select metrics that reflect long-term success, understand trade-offs, and interpret results. We will walk through real-world examples and case studies to show how to run smarter experiments that lead to better products.

session_name: Career Resilience: Thriving Through Change
description: The future won't wait, and neither should your career. This session is about building resilience in the face of change. Leaders will share how they've navigated disruption, embraced new technologies, and designed careers that endure. The focus is on practical inspiration: seeing change as opportunity, and shaping a career path that grows with you, no matter what the future brings.
speaker_name(s): Diane Gonzalez, Mary Beth Westmoreland, Heather Peterson

session_name: Circle of Strength: How Female Friendships can Anchor Mental Health in Tech
description: A deeply personal session on facing burnout, imposter syndrome, and life upheavals while building a tech career-and how authentic female friendships became the lifeline. This talk explores the emotional side of success and the often-overlooked power of community care. In this heartfelt presentation, the speakers share their personal journey through the highs and lows of a career in tech-grappling with moments of self-doubt, burnout, career pivots, and family pressures. Rather than a linear success story, this session sheds light on the messy, human side of ambition. At the heart of this journey lies a quiet but powerful force: female friendship. The speakers will recount specific moments where peers, mentors, and sisterhood circles helped them find clarity, courage, and comfort-especially during periods of mental and emotional distress.
speaker_name(s): Snehal Nahar, Neha Hemant Raut, Pavithra Kannan

session_name: Comedy as a Catalyst
description: This interactive session explores how comedy can inspire agency, resilience, and connection in the face of serious problems such as the climate crisis. Learn how comedy is good for our brains, how to craft and share your own stories to engage diverse audiences, and how to use humor as a powerful, joyful tool for teaching and learning.

session_name: Failing Forward: How an Internship Setback Launched My Career in Tech
description: When you see me today, you see a Customer Solutions Manager at one of the world's leading tech companies, managing over $1 billion in revenue. What you don't see is the early-career version of me—entering a tech internship with no guidance, no mentors, and ultimately, no return offer. It felt like a personal and professional failure—one that shook my confidence and made me question whether I belonged in tech at all. In this talk, I want to share the lessons I learned not after I succeeded, but when I was stumbling. I'll walk through the unspoken skills and strategies I wish someone had told me back then-from how to ask questions that show initiative, to how to use 1:1s to grow, and how to connect your work to real impact. My hope is to set the next generation of women in tech up for success—not by showing them how to be perfect, but how to be resilient, self-aware, and ready to lead, even when the plan falls apart.

session_name: From college to conference rooms: 5 must-do strategies to be limitless as a new grad
description: Starting your first job can feel daunting, but you're not alone! The transition from college to the corporate world can be overwhelming, and in this session, I'll share 5 actionable strategies to help you not only survive but thrive. My own journey began with a literal bang—I broke my foot on day one at work. As someone who was eager and ambitious, that setback was a major curveball. But despite the obstacles, I ended my first year at Microsoft by launching my first feature. I'll share how I turned setbacks into success, teaching you how to step out of your comfort zone, find allies, adapt to change, align with team priorities, and know and voice your interests. Through personal stories, interactive discussion, and practical takeaways, you'll leave with a ready-to-use "Advice Wall" to navigate corporate life with crowdsourced strategies to resolve your fears about starting your first year as a corporate employee. Let's make your first year not just successful—but transformational!

session_name: From Technical Expert to Strategic Leader: Navigating a 27+ Year Tech Career
description: Amanda's journey from technical specialist to strategic executive reveals how combining technical expertise with leadership skills creates paths to executive roles. Starting with a Computer Information Systems diploma, early focus on programming/coding and technical consulting built technical credibility. Her first leadership role at Pythian Group taught crucial lessons in balancing technical work with people management and client relationships. At AWS, Amanda's leadership expanded to directing 85 engineers, 6 managers, and managing a billion-dollar Healthcare & Life Sciences portfolio. This phase showed how technical knowledge drives business strategy and C-suite relationships. Her drive proves technical expertise paired with leadership skills creates career growth opportunities. For technical professionals seeking leadership roles, maintaining technical credibility while developing business acumen leads to impactful positions.

session_name: How Data Scientist can leverage AI'eds superpower to deliver impact
description: Discover how integrating AI into your data science workflow dramatically increases productivity and speeds up time-to-value delivery. We will demo examples of using ChatGPT, GitHub Copilot/Cursor, and other AI tools to eliminate lengthy, repetitive tasks and streamline your daily workflow. The audience will walk away with practical knowledge on how to integrate AI into their daily workflow. We will also share tips to identify and avoid common pitfalls when using AI tools, ensuring reliable results while maximizing their benefits.

session_name: How did you get that job? Strategies for a Successful Career Shift
speaker_name(s): Cristiane de Melo, Preethi Ravula, Sona Rajamani

session_name: Impact Without Seniority: Building Credibility, Craft, and Community in Your First Two Years Without Managing People
description: Offer a framework to scale technical impact while staying close to code. Many technologists crave deeper impact but don't want to become people-managers. This talk unpacks a repeatable framework—"Career Architecture"—for scaling influence as a Staff, Principal, or Distinguished Engineer. We'll walk through a three-pillar model: Technical North Star '96 how to own a strategic architectural vision and keep it evergreen. Organizational API '96 concrete tactics for routing decisions, feedback, and conflict through you (not around you) without a formal team. Execution Flywheel '96 building momentum via proofs-of-concept, metrics dashboards, and "decision engravings" (RFCs, ADRs). Attendees leave with live templates (Markdown + Mermaid), a 90-day influence roadmap, and a playbook for mentoring without line authority. Whether you're eyeing Staff promotion or already wear the title but need sharper influence skills, you'll walk away ready to architect both systems and your career.

session_name: Invisible Work, Visible Impact: Recognizing & Communicating Work That Doesn'edt Show Up on Dashboards
Lead Where You Are: How Community Engagement Elevates Workplace Leadership
Performance Like an Athlete: Balancing Health and Career for Long-Term Success
description: Just as athletes must balance intense training with recovery, data scientists and technologists must balance professional excellence with self-care. In this session, I'll share insights into how managing screen time, nurturing relationships, and connecting with nature can dramatically enhance professional performance, creativity, and sustainability in a high-stakes career.

session_name: Smarter, Not Hotter: Green Principles for AI Design
description: Every AI prompt has a hidden cost - measured not just in dollars, but also in kilowatt-hours. As generative AI becomes more embedded in our workflows, its environmental impact demands attention. This session is designed for product leaders, engineers, and tech advocates who want to build and use AI responsibly. Through real-world case studies, we will unpack the energy footprint of large language models and challenge common assumptions around their usage. Attendees will explore when simpler models outperform LLMs, and learn practical techniques like model pruning, quantization, and green infrastructure choices to reduce energy use. We will also outline how to optimize training and deployment pipelines, ask the right evaluation questions, and adopt a sustainability-first mindset. Attendees will leave with actionable strategies and a clear framework for creating smarter, more efficient, and environmentally responsible AI products.

session_name: Tech for Social Good: Using Technology to Drive Positive Cultural and Societal Impact
description: Tech for Social Good: Using Technology to Drive Positive Cultural and Societal Impact As technology continues to shape the world, its potential to drive social and cultural change is immense. Tech is no longer just a tool for business growth but a powerful instrument to solve complex global challenges like inequality, climate change, and access to education. This session will explore how technology can be used to create positive societal impact and foster cultural advancement, with a focus on how organizations, tech companies, and social initiatives are leveraging technology for good. By presenting real-world case studies, expert insights, and actionable strategies, attendees will understand how technology is addressing societal problems and how they can incorporate social responsibility into their own work. The session will focus on using technology to reduce inequality, combat climate change, and empower marginalized communities.

session_name: The Door Opens for Everyone: How Inclusive Design Unlocks Product Innovation
description: Accessibility is often considered late in the product development cycle, leading to retrofits rather than inclusive innovations. This session advocates for an "Accessibility-First" approach—where designing for edge cases leads to experiences that benefit everyone. From curb cuts to motion-sensor doors, history shows that accessible design often drives mainstream convenience. Today, opening a door with just a wave of the hand serves not only wheelchair users but also parents juggling toddlers or travelers pulling suitcases. Drawing from my research published at ACM CHI 2024, I explore how neurodiverse young adults navigate online job and housing searches, uncovering systemic usability gaps in mainstream platforms. I'll discuss what it means to build products that accommodate cognitive and sensory differences—and how that unlocks better UX for all. Attendees will learn how accessibility-first thinking becomes a force multiplier for usability, customer reach, and product quality.
speaker_name(s): Tanya Jha, Saloni Yadav, Linh Tong

session_name: The Engineering Collaboration Code: Navigating Stakeholders, Teams, and Partners for Project Success
description: Have you ever struggled to align with product managers? Been blocked waiting for other teams' code reviews? Had your design challenged after implementation was already underway? As software engineers, we've all felt the fatigue that comes from poor collaboration. In this session, we'll explore real-life case studies and introduce practical strategies for working effectively with cross-functional roles, engineering teams, and third-party partners throughout the project development lifecycle. Join us to explore actionable approaches for fostering clear communication, building trust, and strong working relationships in fast-paced, cross-team environments.

session_name: Thriving as the "Only" in the Room
Unbound and Balanced: Assertive Parenting for Professionals
description: This workshop empowers participants to master assertive, empathetic communication with hands on activities and practical tools to self-advocate, support family while thriving in the career of one's choice. Reduce Conflict: Navigate challenges without escalating tensions, leading to healthier relationships and less stress. Set Clear Boundaries: Balance work hours, meetings, and family commitments, protect well-being. Build Confidence: Practice to advocate for yourself in high pressure environments. Foster Connection: Assertiveness prioritizes connection over "winning" arguments, to strengthen trust, collaboration with everyone. Communicate Intentionally: Share clear, impactful messages, minime misunderstandings Learning Outcomes '95tGrasp five key principles of assertive communication for work-life balance. '95tPractice setting boundaries and communicating with intention. '95tStrengthen listening and clarity through hands-on group activities.
speaker_name(s): Shivam Khullar, Smitha Sasidharan, Dan Kralovec

session_name: Women Defending the Digital Frontier
AI-Powered Product Management: Using AI to guide product discovery and roadmapping
description: In product management, the greatest challenge isn't just building solutions, it's making sure we're solving the right problem for our customers. Too often, teams rush to deliver features without fully understanding the real needs behind user pain points, leading to wasted effort and missed opportunities. This session explores how AI can revolutionize product management by enabling teams to gather deeper customer insights, validate pain points, and prioritize what truly matters. We'll discuss practical, real-world techniques to leverage AI-powered tools, from intelligent user feedback analysis and trend detection to automating competitor and market research. Attendees will walk through frameworks for translating AI-driven insights into actionable product roadmaps and prioritization matrices.

session_name: Architecting Your Influence: Strategic Career Growth for Women Technologists Rising Into Leadership
description: This presentation empowers women technologists to architect long-term career strategies that align with leadership, national impact, and future-proof technical domains. You'll explore how to build influence beyond execution—by positioning yourself in high-growth fields like AI and cybersecurity, cultivating executive presence, and creating visibility through thought leadership, mentorship, and strategic contributions. Attendees will leave with a proven mindset shift and actionable roadmap to evolve from individual contributors to high-impact leaders, shaping the future of tech and driving innovation with purpose. This session is ideal for mid-career professionals ready for greater influence and legacy.

session_name: Beyond Dev & Ops: Packaging Intelligence in the Cloud and Managing It with AI Agents'ee
description: Cloud teams have already mastered the art of delivering infrastructure and software at scale—but the next frontier is delivering intelligence itself. This session shows how forward-looking organizations are encapsulating reasoning, planning, and decision-making capabilities into reusable "Intelligence-as-a-Service" layers and governing them with autonomous AI agents. We'll trace the journey from classic DevOps pipelines to AgentOps—where Digital teams curate prompt libraries, guardrails, and vector stores instead of RPMs and Docker files.

session_name: Boardroom Innovators: Powering Corporate Transformation
description: Join Tony West, Chief Legal Officer and Corporate Secretary of Uber, for a dynamic conversation with Mandy Ginsberg, former CEO of Match Group; Patricia Nakache, General Partner at Trinity Ventures; and Stephanie Cohen, Chief Strategy Officer at Cloudflare. These accomplished women who are all board members of publicly traded companies will share how their experiences as CEOs and senior leaders shape their approach to governance, strategy, and innovation. Gain insider perspectives on driving transformation, fostering inclusion, and navigating complex challenges at the highest levels of business.
speaker_name(s): Tony West, Mandy Ginsberg, Patricia Nakache, Stephanie Cohen

session_name: Breaking Barriers, Building Bridges (Thriving as a Latina in Tech)
description: What does it mean to succeed in tech without having to shrink parts of who you are? In this session, Estefany, a Mexican born engineer with a decade of experience across Mexico and the U.S. will share her journey navigating the tech industry as a first-generation immigrant, Latina, and woman in STEM. From working in broadcast/audio to leading engineering operations at Amazon and advocating for DEI at scale, Estefany has faced and overcome challenges rooted in identity, isolation, and systemic bias. This talk will empower attendees to reframe their cultural background as a professional superpower, use storytelling to advocate for themselves and others, and build inclusive communities even in the most exclusive spaces. Attendees will walk away with a "Resilience Toolkit".

session_name: Building a Career as an AI Product Manager: Navigating the intersection of technology, business, and people
description: This talk discusses the keys to building a successful career in AI product management, emphasizing the intersection of three critical areas: technology, business, and human experience, which are all essential to building compelling AI products. The discussion will focus on driving product impact with purpose.

session_name: Cloud-Native Development for Beginners
description: Cloud-native development may sound complex, but at its core, it's about building software that thrives in the cloud. This beginner-friendly session breaks down the essentials—cloud platforms (like AWS, Azure, GCP), containers (Docker), and scalable design principles—into digestible, real-world concepts. We'll walk through what it means to "go cloud-native," how teams build resilient systems, and the foundational tools and mindsets that power modern development. If you've ever wondered how cloud apps scale or what containers actually do, this session is your launchpad.

session_name: Decoding Imposter Syndrome: Unmasking the Silent Struggle in Tech
Embracing Cultural Identity for Professional Growth
description: In today's dynamic and ever-changing workplaces, cultural identity stands as a powerful asset. This panel unites women from various backgrounds, industries, and career stages to share their experiences on how embracing cultural identity can drive professional growth, leadership, and innovation. Panelists will reveal how their heritage, lived experiences, and cultural values have shaped their careers and empowered them to lead with authenticity. Through personal stories, practical strategies, and honest dialogue, this session will illuminate how cultural identity can be a catalyst for resilience, creativity, and connection. Attendees will gain valuable insights into navigating professional spaces without compromising their true selves—and leave inspired to view their own identities as sources of strength and empowerment.
speaker_name(s): Ana Parada Mar, Melissa Delgado, Nadia Karim, Lily Kim

session_name: Fighting Financial Fraud with Data: A Research Journey into Identity Theft Detection in Banking
description: This session delves into cutting-edge cybersecurity research focused on detecting identity theft in the U.S. banking system. Using publicly available datasets and machine learning models, my study explores how demographic and behavioral patterns can signal fraudulent activity in real-time. Attendees will gain insight into the research process, from defining the problem and selecting features to training models and analyzing patterns across age groups and geographies. This talk emphasizes not only the technical contributions but also the social importance of protecting vulnerable users in the digital financial ecosystem.

session_name: From Self-Doubt to Software: Rewiring Inferiority to Thrive in Tech
description: In this deeply personal and inspiring presentation, I'll share my journey of growing up with an inferiority complex and feeling like an "average" student — to eventually working on cutting-edge technologies in the global tech industry. This session is designed especially for students and early-career professionals who silently battle self-worth issues, imposter syndrome, and the pressure to "stand out" in an overly competitive world. Through the lens of my story, attendees will learn how to reframe limiting beliefs, build authentic confidence, and carve their own space in tech — not by being perfect, but by being persistent. This is not just a story of success, but a call to recognize the power in your unique journey, no matter where you begin.

session_name: Human-Centered Monitoring: Designing Observability Tools with Empathy and AI
description: In the world of cloud-native systems, observability tools are everywhere—but they're not always built with the humans behind the dashboards in mind. Teams are drowning in alerts, fragmented data, and complicated UIs that often add stress instead of clarity. This session explores how we can flip the script. Drawing from real-world experiences in building large-scale observability solutions, we'll dive into what it means to design with empathy—where user experience, AI, and DevOps come together to create tools that actually help. We'll talk about designing for cognitive load, surfacing insights (not noise), and building interfaces that support thoughtful debugging and fast decision-making. Whether you're a Product Manager, engineer, or designer, you'll leave with practical strategies to build more intuitive, human-first observability experiences that empower teams, not exhaust them.

session_name: Hybrid Agile: Outperforming AI by Delivering Real Results
Impact Ripples: Amplifying Recognition Through Purpose
speaker_name(s): Amanda MacDonald, Sunaina Karve, LeeAnne Dewar

session_name: No CS Degree, No Problem: How I Went From Zero Coding Skills to a Career in Big Tech
description: In this talk, I'll share my journey from having no coding experience to building real-world skills at a small startup, and eventually leveling up again to land a software engineering role at a leading tech company. Along the way, I had to relearn how to learn, build without credentials, and develop the confidence to go after roles that once felt out of reach. This isn't a "just teach yourself to code" story. It's about learning in public, failing forward, and growing through every stage of the journey: from beginner to contributor to someone who now leads teams at a major tech company. Attendees will walk away with: - A realistic roadmap for self-teaching and leveling up - Tactical advice for landing that first job—even if it's not your dream job - How to close the gap between "startup engineer" and "big tech-ready" - Tips on surviving the imposter syndrome that never fully goes away

session_name: The Invisible Engine: Optimizing AI for the Cloud Without Breaking the Bank
description: The rise of cloud-based AI has unlocked unprecedented computing power, but poorly optimized models can skyrocket costs, waste energy, and slow down performance. This talk explores how to fine-tune machine learning algorithms for cloud environments covering: Efficient AI deployment strategies (reducing GPU usage, optimizing model parallelism) Auto-scaling ML workloads for cost-efficient execution The trade-offs between accuracy and compute efficiency How women in AI can lead the shift toward cloud-optimized, sustainable AI solutions With real-world case studies (including my NeurIPS research), this session is designed to help AI practitioners build smarter, faster, and more affordable AI models in the cloud.

session_name: The Manager's Edge: Unlock Your Mentoring Superpowers
description: When I moved from an individual contributor role as a QA engineer to a software development manager, I found that mentoring was a key component of managing that wasn't a skill often taught. Managers need to develop skills beyond project management and task completion to deliver results. Mentoring is a crucial skill managers need to know to create a team where people want to stay and perform their best. In this session I will share mentoring techniques that will supercharge your leadership skills based on my own learnings of what does and doesn't work. I will explain the three components of mentoring: coaching, teaching, and advising and a simple decision tree that will help you create a mental model of when to use each. Then I'll share real-world scenarios to illustrate how to employ the three components to develop people's talents, boost engagement, and build connection.

session_name: The Math Behind the Magic: Understanding the Role of Mathematics in Deep Learning
description: Deep learning often feels like magic — models that recognize faces, translate languages, or even generate art. But under the hood, it's mathematics doing the heavy lifting. In this session, we'll demystify the math that powers deep learning and uncover how key mathematical concepts like linear algebra, calculus, probability, and optimization come together to make neural networks work. This isn't a lecture — it's an intuitive walkthrough that connects math to real AI applications. You'll walk away with practical insights into how math helps build smarter models, debug issues, and innovate responsibly in AI.

session_name: Designing Financial Empowerment for All Minds
description: Today's financial wellness landscape is uniquely challenging. As people live longer and face shifting retirement realities, many rely on digital platforms to build the future they hope for. Yet most fintech tools still follow a one-size-fits-all design, overlooking the needs of neurodivergent individuals who accounts for up to 20% of the population. Women often face greater challenges, as they are frequently underdiagnosed or misdiagnosed due to gender-biased diagnostic criteria. This hands-on workshop challenges the status quo. By embracing neurodiversity as a design advantage, we'll explore how inclusive fintech can empower all users. Through real-world simulations grounded in User-Centered Design, participants will discover emotionally intelligent strategies that are flexible, forgiving, and human-centered. We'll also explore how emerging technologies like AI and adaptive interfaces can unlock more intuitive and accessible financial experiences for all minds.
speaker_name(s): Arian Clay-Sirop, Max Tkach, Katie Zhang

session_name: Mastering Microsoft Power BI and Fabric with Copilot: Your Gateway to Data Excellence
description: Dive into the world's leading business intelligence platform with this interactive workshop designed for all skill levels. In just 60 minutes, you'll go from Power BI novice to creating professional dashboards and understanding Microsoft's revolutionary Fabric ecosystem. Through guided hands-on activities, you'll connect to real data, build compelling visualizations, and learn how these tools drive data-informed decisions across industries. Additionally, we will demonstrate how to effectively use Power BI Copilot to extract meaningful insights from data, streamlining your analysis process. Whether you're exploring careers in business intelligence, data analysis, or simply want to add a highly marketable skill to your portfolio, this workshop provides practical experience with tools used by over 90% of Fortune 500 companies. Leave with working dashboards, practical skills you can immediately apply, and a roadmap for continued growth in the booming field of data analytics.
speaker_name(s): Neha Ghaty Satish, Ojal Mapuskar, Grace Gong

session_name: The Fire You Carry: What Female Rage Can Teach Tech
description: Anger is often dismissed as unprofessional, especially when it comes from women. But what if rage isn't a weakness, but a signal? In this unapologetic session, we explore how female rage, at exclusion, burnout, or broken systems, can be a powerful tool for clarity, boundary-setting, and transformation. Through personal stories and practical tools, we'll reframe rage as data, activism, and leadership fuel. You'll leave with language, frameworks, and community for building something better.
speaker_name(s): ToAnh Tran, Kerri-Leigh Grady, Ana Gosseen, Zhamara Reano

session_name: Thriving Unbound: Building Mental Resilience in Tech's Fast Lane
description: The demanding nature of the technology sector frequently results in burnout, anxiety, and compromised well-being, with particularly significant impacts on women and non-binary professionals. This engaging workshop provides participants with practical tools to prioritize mental health while achieving success in the tech industry. Participants will discover research-backed approaches to prevent burnout, effectively manage stress, and develop resilience through mindfulness practices and healthy boundary establishment. The session incorporates mindfulness meditation techniques, controlled breathing exercises (pranayama), and accessible yoga positions (asana) specifically designed for implementation in technology workplace settings. Through hands-on demonstrations and concrete implementation strategies, attendees will acquire practical methods to incorporate resilience-building practices into their everyday workflows, fostering both personal development and professional advancement.
speaker_name(s): Anjani Reddy, Snehal Nahar, Sandy Kingdon

session_name: I Can Fit That In: The New Rules of Energy, Capacity, and Sustainable Performance
description: What if the secret to doing more wasn't managing your time, but stewarding your energy? Based on Erin's book I Can Fit That In, this keynote redefines productivity for the modern leader. Erin teaches how to protect your energy, align your time with your values, and perform without burnout. It's not about fitting more in—it's about fitting in what matters most. Audience Takeaways: u003culu003e tu003cliu003e'a0Shift from time management to energy stewardshipu003c/liu003e tu003cliu003eCreate rituals that restore vitality and focusu003c/liu003e tu003cliu003eLet go of outdated beliefs around overcommitment, busyness and self-worthu003c/liu003e tu003cliu003eReclaim your time, presence, and poweru003c/liu003e u003c/ulu003e

session_name: Level Up: Gaming for the Generations
description: This session will explore how gaming is for every generation. Adults 50+ are engaging with video games, brain-training apps and interactive technologies not only for fun, but also for cognitive health, social connection and stress relief. Through a dynamic conversation and interactive elements, participants (audience consists of mostly women who are in the tech industry, but men are invited) will learn how play can strengthen memory, attention and problem-solving skills while also reducing loneliness and fostering community. Together, we'll connect the dots between wellness, culture and the growing role of gaming in everyday life for aging adults.

session_name: Breaking Industry Boundaries: How to Successfully Reinvent Your Career
description: From mechanical engineering in power plants to advertising tech, my career path demonstrates that industry boundaries are meant to be crossed. I would lead a session on practical strategies for successful career transitions, drawn from my journey through engineering, chemical operations, AWS data center supply chain, and now customer experience in Amazon advertising. I'll share how one can leverage their unique background to create opportunities in unexpected places.

session_name: Bridging the Gap: How to Thrive in Software Engineering Beyond Academia
description: How is software engineering in industry different from what you learn in a university classroom? How do you prepare to contribute to large codebases and write code that impacts millions of clients? If you find yourself asking these questions, join us to learn from software engineers that were in your shoes not too long ago. This workshop will cover technical tips on how to write production-ready code that is stable, maintainable, and observable, along with common pitfalls that entry-level engineers often face. This session is designed for recent graduates, interns, career changers, and all entry-level engineers looking to contribute impactfully from the start. No matter where you're starting from, this session will empower you with the tips and confidence needed to navigate the early years of your career with success!

session_name: Code Bound: How Apprenticeships Forge the Future of Tech
description: Join us for a dynamic session on the AnitaB.org Apprenticeship Pathway Program (APP), bridging the numbers with the narratives. The session will begin highlighting the measurable impact of apprenticeship programs—covering key metrics like career progression, belonging, and workforce development. Then, settle in for an intimate fireside chat with two program alumni who will share their journeys, challenges, and triumphs. This session offers a glimpse into how policy and programming translate into lived experience. Whether you're a talent strategist, educator, or industry leader, you'll walk away with both the evidence and the empathy needed to champion apprenticeship pathways in your organization.
speaker_name(s): Anny Patino, Erika Karsh, Marlena Roberson-Bullard, Voke Elstein

session_name: Code, Circuits & Courage: Immigrant Journey in Tech
description: Building a career in the tech industry is challenging enough—but doing it as an international student adds another layer of complexity. From navigating immigration systems to adapting to new cultures, and from pursuing a Master's degree in a foreign country to landing roles at top tech companies, this panel brings together four women who've successfully made that journey. Each of us represent a unique path—we come from different backgrounds, and now work at leading companies like Apple, Microsoft, Nvidia, and Google. We'll share candid reflections on what it takes to build a career in tech as an immigrant or international student, including how we tackled: - Navigating job searches and visa challenges - Building networks in a new country - Making strategic career moves in highly competitive environments - We'll also open up about the emotional and mental resilience required, the support systems that helped us thrive, and the importance of community in navigating these transitions.
speaker_name(s): Sweta Shivaramakrishnan, Sushmitha Muthukumar, Saranya Krishnakumar, Roopana Vuppalapati Chenchu, Sruthi Shivaramakrishnan

session_name: Eat. Sleep. AI. Repeat: Building a Career That Keeps Up with the Bots!
description: As AI transforms software engineering—boosting productivity, and reshaping roles it raises key questions: Do engineers need to pivot entirely to AI to stay relevant? How can I master AI while staying up to date with industry skills and keeping my passion for full-stack development? This talk explores how to stay true to SWE while building AI fluency. We'll guide you through learning AI basics, integrating AI tools into your workflow, and adapting to an AI-driven world. AI isn't here to replace engineers—it enhances their work, from writing code to automating tests. We'll cover the benefits of AI, essential skills for staying competitive, and how to integrate AI without losing touch with hands-on development. You'll learn to balance AI knowledge with core software engineering skills, fostering creativity and problem-solving. Whether new to AI or hesitant to embrace it, this session offers practical advice for blending both worlds and staying future-proof in an evolving industry.

session_name: From Agents to Allies: Empowering Technologists with Multi-Agent AI Workflows
description: This session is built for technologists who want to understand how multi-agent systems work, build them from the ground up, and be part of the rapidly growing ecosystem shaping their future. Instead of abstract concepts, we'll explore this shift through real-time demos and an honest, practical look at the tools and frameworks available today.
speaker_name(s): Nghiem Doan, Menaka Kollu, Lakshmi Sindhuja Karuparti

session_name: Gemini in BigQuery: AI for Everyone and Accessible, Cloud-Agnostic Data Innovation for Women in Tech
description: Join us for a dynamic session where women in tech lead the charge in unlocking AI's true potential in data engineering. Discover how Gemini in BigQuery makes AI accessible and cloud-agnostic, empowering everyone—from analysts to engineers—to automate, optimize, and transform data pipelines. Learn about smart SQL code generation, comprehensive code explanation and completion, and innovative Python code generation techniques. Experience hands-on demonstrations with an interactive data canvas and streamlined data preparation that can radically simplify your workflows. Cut through the hype and focus on impactful, customer-driven outcomes as we showcase how AI is democratizing data innovation, enhancing efficiency, and delivering real business insights. Embrace the future of data-centric tech with tools that empower every data worker.

session_name: Hello World, Meet Me: A Workshop on Personal Branding using AI
description: Overview: This workshop is designed to empower women in tech to communicate with confidence, creativity, and authenticity in professional environments. Leveraging AI tools, participants will learn how to master the art of introductions, elevator pitches, and personal branding in a way that's anything but boring. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Objectives: 1. Learn how AI can assist in crafting compelling elevator pitches. 2. Create a unique introductory note that stands out from mainstream clich'e9s. 3. Explore creative tools to visualize and enhance personal branding. 4. Gain confidence in real-world and digital networking scenarios. 5. Understand how to maintain authenticity while using AI-generated content.

session_name: Leading Engineering teams by bridging the Gap between Tech and Business
description: As an Engineering Manager / Tech Leader, you are a building block holding the engineering and technical pillars. You also act as a translators between tech and business stakeholders. However, because of this gap often leads to misaligned priorities, decisions without incorrect research which can lead to frustration and loss of $$ for the company. As a leader, your team's and company's success relies not just on your technical expertise, but also your understanding of the moving business ask. This session would help enlighten on : - Differences between business and technical priorities - Communication Barriers - Conflicting View resolution - Encouraging Long term vision for the product

session_name: Lights, Camera, Pivot: How a Life-Altering Moment Inspired My Career Reinvention
description: Ever felt stuck on a career path that wasn't aligning with your passions? Sometimes it takes life's unexpected plot twists to rewrite our stories. Join me for a heartfelt and deeply personal session as I share my unconventional journey from defense engineering to theme parks, cruise ships, marketing - and ultimately filmmaking. When faced with a life-altering medical decision, I chose to embrace the unexpected, channeling my experience into my passion project: producing my own film. Learn how your existing skills can serve as your personal script for an exciting career pivot into fields you've dreamed of but never pursued. Come prepared for laughter, reflection, and inspiration to courageously step into your next chapter, no matter how untraditional.

session_name: Mastering the Corporate Maze: Unlocking Success Beyond the Code
description: Join us for an exclusive workshop designed to empower students and professionals to thrive in today's dynamic corporate environments. Led by experienced leaders, Shawn McCarthy and Vivien Wong, this session will delve into the unique challenges and opportunities that extend beyond technical expertise. Participants will explore skills such as relationship management, effective communication, strategic networking, and compelling business storytelling. These competencies are crucial for navigating the complex matrix structures of leading organizations. Whether you're aiming to expand your career horizons or unlock new possibilities, this workshop is your gateway to mastering the art of corporate success. Engage in interactive activities, gain insights from real-world scenarios, and learn how to leverage digital channels and internal communications to drive innovation and impact. Don't miss this opportunity to enhance your professional toolkit and step confidently into the corporate arena.

session_name: Own the Room, Shape the Roadmap: Finding Your Voice as an EiC PM
description: As a product or program manager early in your career, it can feel intimidating to speak up in rooms full of senior engineers and decision-makers. This session empowers EiC PMs to build confidence, influence without authority, and develop the strategic voice needed to drive alignment, customer obsession, and innovation. Panelists will share real-world tactics to earn trust, lead with clarity, and grow into impactful change agents—no matter your title.

session_name: Release Your Mind for Success: How Women Leaders Achieve Success Without Sacrificing Themselves
description: The evolution of the workplace, hybrid, remote, and return-to-office, has redefined how we balance professional and personal lives. Join accomplished women leaders from technology, consulting, and public sectors as they reveal real-world strategies for empowered mental health, dealing with stress, setting boundaries, and achieving sustainable success. Learn how they navigate stress, manage expectations, embrace strategic projects, and still prioritize personal wellness & growth. We will explore - Setting effective boundaries & managing team expectations. - Embracing work involving strategic initiatives - Prioritizing mental health - Ways to refresh the mind while making a global impact - Building sustainable career growth while maintaining personal priorities - Leveraging technology and tools for better time management This panel delivers proven strategies from leaders who've thrived amid evolving work models. Walk away with actionable tactics and a mindset shift for the future of work
speaker_name(s): Andrea Peng, Smriti Singh, Lily Wong, Ramu Murakami Gutierrez

session_name: Server-Driven UI: LinkedIn's Journey to Accelerated UI Development
description: In a world where software development must be fast, consistent, and adaptive across platforms, server-driven UI (SDUI) has emerged as a powerful approach to accelerate front-end development. This panel will explore how LinkedIn's adoption of SDUI empowers teams to build once and deploy seamlessly across web, iOS, and Android — reducing time-to-market while maintaining a cohesive, high-quality user experience. We'll unpack the key benefits of SDUI, like accelerated UI development, platform consistency, and seamless migrations. Our panelists will dive into critical architectural decisions: what belongs in the foundation (infra) vs. feature (product) layers, and what should remain configurable vs. locked down to preserve UX consistency. With voices from across engineering — spanning platforms, infra teams, product leads, and DevX tool creators — this session will bring diverse perspectives on the challenges, solutions, and real-world impact of SDUI at scale.
speaker_name(s): Jing Zhao, Lucy Lin, Eidarli Aung, Karen Tseng, Cleo Chow

session_name: Show Up, Speak Up, and Stand out: Make an impact at your workplace
description: LET ME GUESS... u8594 You're a skilled professional who contributes consistently but feels your ideas aren't making the impact they deserve u8594 You see colleagues confidently shaping discussions and wonder how they command such influence u8594 You're good at your job, but feel invisible in meetings and decision-making processes YOU'RE HELD BACK BY: u8594 Uncertainty about when and how to contribute meaningfully u8594 Fear of speaking up in high-stakes environments u8594 Imposter syndrome when surrounded by vocal colleagues u8594 Worry about being perceived as too passive THEN THIS SESSION IS FOR YOU! In this session, I'll share u8594 Actionable techniques to amplify your voice in meetings and decision forums u8594 How to build and leverage your unique technical perspective u8594 Practical ways to communicate complex ideas with clarity and confidence u8594 Real examples of how small visibility shifts led to major career opportunities u8594 Building a reputation that extends beyond your immediate team See you there!

session_name: Strong, smart, struggling: Let's Talk Mental Health in Tech
description: In tech, mental health is often the last thing we talk about—but the first thing to suffer. As a first-time mom returning to work in tech, I've experienced the mental load many women quietly carry. This pressure is intensified by burnout, imposter syndrome, and the need to prove themselves. Through storytelling, myth-busting, and guided reflection, this session opens space for honest conversation, community connection, and practical strategies to protect your emotional well-being. Whether you're a team lead, a junior dev, or just feeling the weight of always being "on," this talk will offer insights, tools, and a powerful reminder: you are not alone.

session_name: Tech That Cares: Redesigning AI for Children, Citizens, and the Planet
description: My journey as a CTO and AI architect has taken me into some of the most high-stakes and human-centered environments — implementing generative AI for citizen services, leading AI architecture for a UN-powered sustainability platform, and co-founding a nonprofit to safeguard children from the harms of artificial intelligence. These diverse, real-world experiences have shaped how I approach technology: not just as a system builder, but as a steward of safety, equity, and care. This session is for technologists who believe AI can and should serve the public good — but who also recognize that good intentions aren't enough. You'll also learn how we're building AI chatbots for citizen services and RAG-based solutions to reduce misinformation, and AI for sustainability. This talk goes beyond "bias in training data" to uncover the systemic challenges in public sector AI — limited compute, conflicting incentives, and communities that are too often left out of the design process.

session_name: The GPU: Powering the AI Revolution
description: GPUs are at the heart of the modern AI revolution, transforming how we train and deploy machine learning models. Unlike CPUs, which handle a few tasks at a time, GPUs are designed for massive parallel processing, making them ideal for the matrix-heavy operations in deep learning. Originally built for graphics rendering, GPUs have evolved into powerful general-purpose processors thanks to tools like CUDA and AI frameworks such as TensorFlow and PyTorch. They enable rapid development of large-scale models used in language generation, image synthesis, autonomous systems, and more. As AI models grow in size and complexity, GPUs continue to push the boundaries of what's possible, accelerating innovation across industries and shaping the future of intelligent technologies.

session_name: Unlocking Research as an Undergrad: How to Dive Into Discovery Early
description: Undergraduate research isn't just for future academics — it's one of the most powerful ways to deepen your learning, gain hands-on experience, and stand out in your career. This session explores the major benefits of doing research as a student, from building critical thinking and problem-solving skills to expanding your professional network and strengthening your resume. I'll share insights from teaching a class of 35 high school students about the world of undergraduate research: what kinds of projects students work on, what skills they develop, and how those experiences open doors to internships, graduate programs, and leadership roles. Whether you're curious about contributing to cutting-edge technology, exploring big questions, or simply leveling up your college experience, this talk will show you why research is worth it.

session_name: Vibe Coding for Leaders
description: Join Wall Street Journal bestselling author Gene Kim and AI coding pioneer Steve Yegge for an interactive session on the future of software development. Drawing from their upcoming book Vibe Coding, they'll share how AI is transforming how we build, collaborate, and innovate. Learn practical ways to work with AI coding tools, adapt engineering practices, and embrace new levels of speed, creativity, and autonomy in your teams.

session_name: Zero to Fifty: Engineering sub-50ms IAM architecture for high-stakes gaming platforms
description: In the competitive world of online gaming, every millisecond of authentication delay directly impacts user experience, revenue, and security. To address these challenges, we will introduce an innovative identity and access management architecture that consistently achieves sub-50ms authentication speed. This architecture leverages cutting-edge technologies such as multi-factor authentication (MFA), single sign-on (SSO), and advanced cryptographic algorithms to ensure both speed and security. Our session will delve into the best engineering practices, including the use of serverless computing to optimize performance. We will provide implementation details, covering aspects like identity proxy, authorization, the integration of AI-driven anomaly detection to enhance security. Additionally, we will present measurable results from various case studies, demonstrating how our architecture has successfully reduced authentication times and improved user satisfaction in real-world scenarios.

session_name: Beyond Burnout: Thriving in Big Tech's Fast Lane
description: In this age of rapid change, high expectations and a go, go work environment and culture, how do we show-up, do excellent work, yet not overachieve to the point of exhaustion and breaking ourselves physically and mentally. We will share what signs to look for in burning out and how you can both prevent and recover from burn-out through candid personal stories from tech professionals. Stories will include how relentless pressure and perfectionism can push even the most passionate workers to the brink of exhaustion with a focus on recovery and resilience: how to set healthy boundaries, seek support, and redefine success to break the burnout cycle. Attendees will gain practical strategies '96 from unplugging without guilt to finding balance and purpose '96 that help transform burnout from an ending into a new beginning. With the right approaches, it's possible not just to recover, but to thrive in tech with renewed energy and fulfillment.
speaker_name(s): Saloni Yadiv, Sara Fratianne, Melissa Delgado, Lily Kim

session_name: Combating Stereotypes in Tech
description: This panel brings together senior leaders and changemakers to explore how stereotypes—whether based on gender, race, age, background, or role and continue to shape the tech industry. Through candid conversation and lived experiences, panelists will unpack the impact of these biases on innovation, leadership, and career progression. Attendees will gain actionable insights on how to challenge assumptions, foster inclusive cultures, and lead with intention in environments where diversity is both a strength and a necessity.
speaker_name(s): Sirisha Garapati, Marivi Stuchinsky, Meg Roughen, Marizette Galvez, Doreen Viloria

session_name: Creating Psychologically Safe Tech Workplaces: Bridging the Gap Between Performance and Wellbeing
description: The tech industry's high-pressure environment has created unprecedented mental health challenges. This panel brings together diverse experts to explore the intersection of wellbeing and tech workplace culture. Our panelists, Software Development Manager, Head of Data & AI, Business Intelligence Engineers and Technical Program Manager will guide discussions on controversial topics like productivity vs. wellbeing and remote work's impact on mental health. Through dynamic exchanges, we'll examine core debates around performance metrics versus wellness measures and company obligation in mental health support. The session will provide attendees with understanding of tech-specific challenges, practical strategies for building resilient work cultures, and skills in recognizing stress signs and setting boundaries. Join us in reimagining a tech industry where mental health is actively prioritized through actionable approaches for both individual and organizational change.
speaker_name(s): Siddhi Patil, Liza Ogwel, Shamina Merchant

session_name: Data that Delivers: How to Meet Both ESG and ROI Goals
description: In this presentation, participants will explore how to transform Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) initiatives into measurable outcomes that drive business success. While many organizations aim to pursue ESG goals, they often struggle with aligning these objectives to tangible business results. This session will provide insights on how to define, measure, and track ESG performance while linking it directly to Return on Investment (ROI), ensuring that both goals are actionable and valuable to business decision-makers.

session_name: Designing Beyond the Vibes: Building Secure, Scalable Software in the GenAI Era
speaker_name(s): Kayla Kerrigan, Christine Tu, Ashish Depankaj, Janet Onyeche Audu, Udita Gupta

session_name: Frontier Firms in Action: Microsoft's playbook for AI skill adoption
Multiple Career Paths to Robotics
description: Hear the stories of multiple women who have found a career in robotics '96 traditional, non-traditional, academia, industry, startups. Software, hardware and more! We will use the field of robotics as a case study in how there are many paths into a career field, but also cover advice and tips that are broadly applicable to getting into any field complementary to computer science. There will be plenty of time for an interactive Q&A with the audience.
speaker_name(s): Annika Wollschlaeger, Laura Herlant, Elizabeth Mittmann, Harshita Bhurat, Dawn Wendell

session_name: Preserving the Magic: Finding Joy and Purpose in Uncertain Times
description: In moments of burnout, instability, or personal struggle, it can be difficult to remember why we started. Holding onto the spark that brought us to tech is, in itself, a technical skill that we can all refine. Join Software Engineers from The Walt Disney Company as they share their stories and hard-earned strategies for staying grounded and hopeful amid the chaos. This includes not only seeking resources and fulfillment outside of work, but also advocating for accommodations and building community within the workplace. This discussion will center emotional intelligence, self-awareness, self-advocacy, and fostering community as career-critical tools, inviting attendees to explore how "soft" skills can build resilience, especially in unpredictable times. From chronic health issues to caregiving responsibilities to career anxiety, we will reflect on how to reconnect with purpose, embrace vulnerability, nurture unity, and cultivate joy — how to find the light when the future is unclear.
speaker_name(s): Gauri Mishra, Lilith Matthews, Natalie Goldstein, Ifteda Ahmed-Syed

session_name: Scaling Magic: Engineering Disney'eds Real-Time Messaging Platform
description: How does Disney ensure millions of users receive the right message at the right time? From real-time sports alerts on ESPN+ to Disney+ content recommendations, messaging is a critical component of user engagement. Behind the scenes, engineers must build scalable, resilient systems to deliver personalized, high-volume notifications across multiple platforms. Join engineers from Disney's Messaging Platform team as they discuss the challenges of building and maintaining a large-scale messaging system. This panel will dive into backend architecture, personalization strategies, and real-time data pipelines that power Disney's messaging experiences. Learn how the team ensures reliability, optimizes system performance, and leverages AWS cloud infrastructure to support millions of messages daily. Whether you're interested in backend engineering, distributed systems, or real-time messaging, this session will provide insights into the technical backbone that keeps Disney fans connected.
speaker_name(s): Stephanie George, Susana Rodriguez-Coria, Emma Koslow, Natalie Ng

session_name: Socially Responsible Tech -- Why Bother?
description: Why invest in creating socially responsible technology? After all, creating more responsible tech is hard, expensive, and likely less profitable. What reward and organizational structures are needed to enable companies and universities to support responsible tech, and "grow" socially responsible technologists? Attendees will hear about how the public sector, academia and industry view the value of socially responsible innovation, design and development, and what matters most to companies in this challenging climate. Why does social responsibility matter and what strategies are effective in promoting responsible tech? The panel will be moderated by Fran Berman, Director of the Public Interest Tech (PIT) Initiative at UMass. Panelists include Emily Nutwell, PIT Pathways Director at UMass, Kathy Pham, VP of AI at WorkDay, Josh Greenberg, Program Director at the Sloan Foundation, and Michelle Shevin, founder of the Future Preservation Society.
speaker_name(s): Josh Greenberg, Kathy Pham, Francine Berman, Emily Nutwell, Michelle Shevin

session_name: Stories from the Trenches: Women Building Tech
speaker_name(s): Lilia Abaibourova, Monalisa Chati, Sophia Gu, Muazma Zahid

session_name: Streaming Magic: Stories From Women Building the Future of Video Delivery at Disney
description: At Disney, storytelling is at the heart of everything we do — even as technologists powering global streaming distribution. In this panel, four women across Disney's Media Engineering org — spanning ML to product — share stories of working at a legacy media giant that's also building the future of streaming. From early-career ICs to working moms in leadership, each panelist shares their unique lens.
speaker_name(s): Lisa Flaherty, Amy Ma, Siri Talatam, Tiffeny Chen

session_name: Switching Industries: Tech Careers Without Borders
description: A panel discussion featuring women in technology whose careers have spanned multiple sectors, sharing their experience leading across different domains. The panel will cover topics such as navigating transitions, learning new industries, and how leadership evolves across sectors. The session will be insightful, practical, and empowering for those interested in exploring!
speaker_name(s): Joy Laibl, Shakira Kelly, Haiben Chin, Dana-Nicole Samuel

session_name: Tech's Career Compass: Navigating the Leadership Career Crossroads Journey
description: To manage or not to manage? That is the question many rising tech stars face as they reach a career crossroads. Join accomplished women leaders as they share their journeys navigating the fork between individual contributor and management paths. Learn how they evaluated their strengths, interests and impact to chart fulfilling careers - whether as technical visionaries, people leaders, or both. Discover why leadership isn't limited to management titles and how you can craft a winding career path aligned to your evolving goals. Walk away with strategies to make this pivotal decision based on your authentic self, not external expectations.
speaker_name(s): Shruti Mehrotra, Sujatha Guthikonda, Sarah Henrikson, Ramani Sankavaram, Michelle Perroton

session_name: What's in a name? A Career Exploration Panel for Tech Roles
description: What does a Technical Program Manager actually do? How is a Data Scientist's job different from a Software Engineer's? And how do people end up in these roles in the first place? This session brings together three Microsoft engineers—one Software Engineer, one Data Scientist, and one Technical Program Manager—to break down what their jobs really involve, how they got there, and what surprised them along the way. From community college to early college, tutoring startups to teaching CS, each panelist brings a unique story of exploration, uncertainty, and figuring it out as they go. Moderated by Kelsea Pullin, whose career centers on mentorship and uplifting others, the panel will cover how these roles collaborate, what setbacks shaped their journeys, and the myths people often believe about their jobs. Attendees will walk away with clearer expectations, relatable stories, and encouragement to explore paths that might not look traditional—but still lead exactly where they're meant to go.
speaker_name(s): Amanda Ong, Teresa Rexin, Nana Wu, Mounika Vanka

session_name: AI safety controls at scale in the cloud
description: This session offers developers a practical deep dive into creating responsible AI systems. This talk addresses the critical need for content safety and policy compliance in AI applications, demonstrating how to implement effective guardrails. Through live demos and real-world examples, attendees will learn to set up denied topics, configure content filters, and integrate safety measures with AI agents. We'll explore the architecture of the solution, best practices for implementation, and strategies for testing and validation. Whether you're a seasoned ML engineer or just starting with generative AI, you'll gain valuable insights into balancing AI functionality with ethical considerations. Join me to acquire the tools and knowledge needed to develop AI applications that are not only powerful but also aligned with organizational policies and safety standards.
speaker_name(s): Winnie Chen-Kraemer, Tiffany Chen, Laura Salinas

session_name: Design Like a Pro: From Empathy to Prototype in 60 Minutes
description: Have an idea but not sure where to start? In this hands-on design thinking workshop, you'll learn how to turn your ideas into low-fidelity prototypes and communicate them with clarity and impact. Led by Adobe and Google professionals, this session will walk you through a simplified design thinking process — from user empathy to paper prototyping — all without needing to code or design digitally. Walk away with a tangible prototype and the confidence to share and iterate on your ideas.

session_name: Force multiplying mentoring
Revolutionizing Technology Workflows with AWS PartyRock: A Hands-On Approach to Scalable Innovation
description: Discover how AWS PartyRock empowers organizations to transform business workflows and streamline operations using the power of Generative AI. This session will explore innovative strategies for leveraging PartyRock to create AI-driven solutions that automate complex tasks, enhance decision-making, and boost operational efficiency. Through real-world examples, industry-specific use cases, and practical demonstrations, participants will gain actionable insights to deploy scalable solutions, address critical business challenges, and drive impactful innovation in their organizations. Enables Individuals, Teams and Organizations in a faster PoC/Poot and GTM leveraging AWS Partyrock to build quick solutions for customers bringing-in No code interface, Rapid prototyping, Cost-Effective, Enhanced productivity with faster GTM, Customer engagement , Content generation with a plethora of LLMs to choose from with the best accuracy & effectiveness.

session_name: The Energy Edge: Optimize Your Health, Elevate Your Career
AI & Data: Strategic Assets for Innovation, Privacy, and an Equitable Future
description: In the digital age, data and artificial intelligence (AI) have become foundational assets—driving innovation, competitive advantage, and social impact. This presentation explores how organizations can unlock the value of data through Responsible AI, while ensuring strong data governance and privacy. Attendees will gain insight into how ethical data practices not only mitigate risk but also build trust, reduce bias, and promote inclusion. We'll dive into real-world examples where AI and data have been leveraged to drive growth and operational efficiency while advancing equity and protecting individual rights. By the end, participants will understand how to approach AI and data strategy in a way that is secure, fair, and future-ready.
speaker_name(s): Kai Two Feathers Orton, Kasia Szczerbinski, Jeanette Jordan, Ash Coleman, Hollie King

session_name: A Playbook for Accessible Chatbots and AI Agents
description: Artificial Intelligence is here and everyone wants to leverage this emerging technology. How can we make sure AI is implemented accessibly? The MITRE Corporation created a playbook with guidance on designing and developing accessible chatbots and AI agents, addressing federal requirements that people with disabilities have access to services and information comparable to those without disabilities.
speaker_name(s): Amna Abbas, Jennifer Strickland, Ronna ten Brink

session_name: Beyond Binary Thinking: The Power of Interdisciplinary Thinking in Technology Leadership
description: We all know diversity drives innovation, but diversity of experience is an under-utilized, powerful source of perspectives and thought. This panel assembles a group of leaders who bring non-traditional backgrounds to tech and who are successfully transforming technical problem-solving. In this session, we will explore how their cross-domain expertise helps their teams create more resilient solutions and drive innovation beyond traditional boundaries.
speaker_name(s): Arthi Krishna, ToAnh Tran, Kerri-Leigh Grady, Ana Gosseen, Zhamara Reano

session_name: Beyond Code: Building AI Products with Ethics, Empathy, and Edge
description: AI today isn't just about algorithms — it's about the values we encode into systems that touch millions of lives. In this dynamic panel, we gather builders, researchers, and visionaries who are reimagining what it means to create AI with ethics, emotional intelligence, and human impact at the forefront. This session explores the increasingly urgent question: How do we move beyond code — and into care — when building AI systems? With real-world examples from GenAI tools, IoT assistants, and LLM-based interfaces, this panel dissects: How to design for emotional safety and trust in AI How to balance innovation with accountability and consent How edge AI, privacy, and emotional signals intersect in everyday tech Panel invites attendees to challenge industry norms and step into their own power as ethical, empathetic AI leaders.

session_name: Black Women Reclaiming Space in Tech
description: What happens when you're building a career in tech while constantly navigating the feeling of being an outsider? In this powerful and deeply honest panel, Black women in tech, including featured panelist Alexis Williams, share what it truly means to push past exclusion, isolation, and bias to find power, purpose, and community in an industry that often wasn't built with them in mind. Through raw storytelling and lived expertise, this conversation will explore the emotional toll of being "the only one," the coded barriers to entry, and the transformative strategies Black women use to not only survive, but thrive, in tech.
speaker_name(s): Alexis Williams, Charlie Jarvis, Awa Sanneh, Mayola Charles

session_name: Breaking Barriers: Where Technical Expertise Meets Passion
description: Join Apple leaders for a dynamic panel discussion to hear how the intersection between passion and technical expertise, has led to breaking barriers. Our panel discussion, aims to foster collaboration, knowledge exchange, professional growth, and inspire technical excellence across various products and services

session_name: Breaking Into Tech Product Management, No Matter Where You Start
description: The technology sector offers exciting opportunities for product managers from traditional industries, but making the transition can be challenging. This panel brings together successful PMs who have navigated the journey from non-technical industries to leading technical products. They'll share their strategies for building technical knowledge, overcoming imposter syndrome, and leveraging their existing product skills in a new context. Our panelists will discuss practical approaches to learning technical concepts, building credibility in a new domain, and using their unique perspectives from traditional industries to drive innovation in tech products. Whether you're actively planning a transition or curious about opportunities in technical product management, this session provides actionable insights and honest discussion about the challenges and rewards of making the switch.
speaker_name(s): Archana Raghu, Bhoomika Ghosh, Aditi Agrawal, Kelsy Foulstone, Ana Sofia Rodriguez del Campo Willems

session_name: Do you know your numbers? Learn how to build your Financial Acumen as a Woman in Tech
description: Financial acumen is your ability to see the financial effects and relationships of various aspects of your business. You can grow and increase your revenue and, correspondingly, your career, if you understand the financial aspects of it. The "why" for building financial acumen for women in tech is clear, the question this panel attempts to answer is how. The panelists represent a diverse group of women in tech leaders from Northwestern Mutual, U.S. Bank, Chubb, and Geico. The moderator is a woman in tech leader from Northwestern Mutual. Each of the panelists will answer questions elicited by the moderator around their diverse paths and experiences. Their journeys have ranged from taking advantage of opportunities at work to embed themselves with business partners, to maximizing educational resources by gaining a CFP designation, to understanding the details of Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) and Return on Investment (ROI) for their portfolio.
speaker_name(s): Anupama Pakala, Ruchi Batra, Uma Morjaria, Keyuri Shah, Neelam Mohanty

session_name: Engineering the Backbone: Building the Live Platform Services Behind AAA Games
description: What does it take to run the invisible infrastructure behind the world's most-played games? In this panel, engineering and product leaders from three of Electronic Arts' foundational platform teams - Marketplace (virtual economies), Social (player connectivity) and Exchange (player-to-player gifting) - come together to explore how they design for scale, empower game teams, and lead through constant change. From supporting 10M-player launches to enabling real-time social systems across genres, panelists will share lessons from the trenches of platform engineering and cross-functional leadership. Each speaker will kick off with a defining insight, followed by a lively discussion on scaling strategy, cross-team alignment, system resilience, and building always-on services that serve billions of operations daily.
speaker_name(s): Manu Sharma, Sadaf Rouhani, Maalika Tadinada, Victoria Sykora-Lovaas, Samanwita Pal

session_name: GABI: Gilead's women-led GenAI initiative highlights innovation, collaboration & diversity in pharma
description: This panel session delves into the journey of a women-led team at Gilead as they spearheaded the development of Gilead Answer Bot with Intelligence (GABI), an internal generative AI application. The initiative entirely conceived and executed internally, represents a milestone in developing a production-ready Gen AI tool within a biopharma setting that sets the standard for innovation, collaboration, and excellence. This session offers an in-depth look at the roles, challenges, and triumphs behind the creation of GABI, featuring the unique perspectives of key contributors and the moderator, Leticia, who brings an external lens as a third-party observer. The panel includes Vaishali (R&D Lead- unstructured data analyses), Angela (R&D Lead- structured data analyses, Lanhui Wang (Production Lead), and Janice (Legal Lead), with Leticia moderating the discussion. Their diverse expertise and roles make for a thought-provoking and dynamic dialogue.
speaker_name(s): Vaishali Chaudhuri, Lanhui Wang, Leticia Croffi, Angela Xie, Chitra Narsimhachari

session_name: Neurodiversity in Tech - Women's Voices, Lived Experiences
description: The technology sector is celebrated for innovation, disruption, and pushing boundaries—qualities that often align closely with neurodiverse thinking. It's estimated that 15 to 20% of the global population is neurodivergent; that's one in five people. Yet, despite these numbers and a growing acknowledgment of neurodiversity in the workplace, many neurodivergent individuals—particularly women—face significant challenges in being recognized, understood, and supported. The lived experiences of neurodiverse professionals—particularly women—remain underrepresented in conversations around inclusion and equity. This panel brings together four neurodiverse women in technology who will share their candid stories, professional journeys, and the systemic challenges they've encountered and overcome.
speaker_name(s): Preethi Parthasarathy, Allison Baker, April Lebahn, Jennifer Schachter, Rose Shuman

session_name: Technical Enough:How Humanities Majors Are Leading Tech'f3And What Engineers Need to Learn Beyond Code
description: This panel reclaims the "not technical enough" narrative directed at humanities majors, typically framed as a limitation or pivot, and reframes it as a strategic advantage to actively cultivate in today's tech landscape. With 75% of employers saying soft skills are as or more important than technical skills—and as AI demands more ethical, user-centered, and systems-thinking approaches—this conversation is urgent. Our panelists, all tech leaders with humanities roots, will explore how storytelling, critical thinking, research, and cultural fluency have uniquely positioned them to drive innovation in GenAI, advertising, and consumer products—and to lead in high-impact technical environments. We'll challenge the "technical vs. non-technical" binary, showing that deep expertise takes many forms—and that today's most impactful technologists often blur those lines. This session also invites engineers to expand their leadership toolkit by embracing the human skills that supercharge growth.
speaker_name(s): Susan Westwater, Anna Jeon, Kristen Petrenko, Trishala Pillai

session_name: The Future of Women's Health: Research, Technology, and Equity
description: Women's health has historically been underfunded, under-researched, and underserved—but a transformative shift is underway. This session explores the cutting-edge innovations, emerging research paradigms, and equity-focused initiatives reshaping women's healthcare for the better. The conversation will spotlight critical research gaps being addressed by the next generation of scientists including studies on conditions that predominantly affect women, the impact of hormonal cycles on disease progression, and long-neglected areas like postpartum health and perimenopause. We'll also discuss how inclusive clinical trials and diverse research cohorts are finally centering the experiences of women across different races, ethnicities, socioeconomic backgrounds, and gender identities.
speaker_name(s): Shannah Van Winkle, Brittany Barreto, PhD, Jennifer Hintzsche, Oluwateniola Brown, MD

session_name: Unbound with AI: How Tech Leaders leverage GenAI to Thrive at Work- and in Life
description: Gen AI isn't just transforming how we work, it's redefining how we live. But how do we harness it not just for productivity, but for navigating a life of balance and purpose? In this dynamic, cross-industry panel, a Senior Enterprise Engineer at AWS, a Senior Product Manager at Oracle, and a Senior Data Scientist at Microsoft share how they use GenAI to streamline workflows, fuel creativity, and support holistic well-being. From drafting performance reviews and building personal brands to planning vacations, tracking physical and mental wellness goals, and automating content creation segments, discover how GenAI fuels their 9-to-5 and 5-to-life! You'll gain practical insights into no and low-cost AI tools, prompting tips, and exclusive access to a fine-tuned GPT designed by the three panelists for GHC attendees to navigate a well-balanced life. Their diverse roles and life stages ensure a lively, actionable conversation on how to harness GenAI for both professional & personal growth.
speaker_name(s): Andrea Peng, Smriti Singh, Lily Wong, Ramu Murakami Gutierrez

session_name: Vibe Coding for Leaders
description: Join Wall Street Journal bestselling author Gene Kim and AI coding pioneer Steve Yegge for an interactive session on the future of software development. Drawing from their upcoming book Vibe Coding, they'll share how AI is transforming how we build, collaborate, and innovate. Learn practical ways to work with AI coding tools, adapt engineering practices, and embrace new levels of speed, creativity, and autonomy in your teams.

session_name: Women Driving Innovation in Autonomous Tech: Shaping the Future of Mobility
description: This session brings together female leaders in autonomous vehicle (AV) development and deployment to discuss their role in transforming transportation. The panel aims to highlight the contributions of women driving innovation, address challenges in tech leadership, and explore how inclusive teams shape better, more ethical AV solutions.

session_name: Your PM Career Playbook Is Outdated'f3Thanks to AI. Here'eds the Rewrite
description: How do you grow a career in roles that AI threatens to automate, or radically transform? As AI reshapes the tech industry, Product and Technical Program Managers find themselves at pivotal crossroads. Join four AI PMs and TPMs from Microsoft, ranging from early in career to principal level, as they discuss how career growth is evolving in this new era. From practical strategies to philosophical shifts, each panelist offers a unique lens into how we can reinvent and thrive, not just survive, in the new AI era.
speaker_name(s): Suvarna Saraswat, Jayda El Hakie, Miti Joshi, Christa Simaan, Shreya Singh

session_name: (Ay)I Glowed Up: How Women of Color Can Use AI Agents to Build the Lives of Their Dreams
