description: Session Description AI isn't just for coders anymore—and it's time women of color led the next era of automation. This interactive workshop introduces an AI agent, CHATty GuPTa, who explores how intelligent assistants can support branding, strategy, and vision implementation for modern creators and founders. While this session centers the needs and experiences of women of color—who are too often excluded from emerging tech spaces—it is open to all attendees interested in building ethical, intuitive, and personalized AI tools. We'll break down prompting frameworks, values-aligned design, and no-code automation strategies to help participants begin mapping how AI can be used as sacred, strategic tool to build with clarity, power, and purpose. Presenter Bio Kela X. Harris is a seasoned IT professional, AI educator, and Navy veteran who founded SUPANOVAS AI—a spiritual-tech platform designed to help women of color lead in AI, automation, and digital transformation.

session_name: Help! What Kind of Dev Do I Want to be?
speaker_name(s): Mandy Meindersma, Jasmine Woo, Helen Gezahegn

session_name: Model Context Protocol (MCP): The Next Frontier of Generative AI
description: As generative AI moves from experimentation to enterprise-scale adoption, the need for structure, control, and context becomes critical. Enter the Model Context Protocol (MCP)—a new paradigm that standardizes how applications communicate with foundation models using modular, context-rich instructions. MCP enables safer, more interpretable, and reusable GenAI workflows by separating business logic from prompts and embedding policy and governance into interactions. This session will explore how MCP is reshaping the GenAI application stack, empowering developers to build scalable, secure, and human-aligned AI systems.

session_name: Tell your Story: Resume Building Workshop
description: This workshop aims to offer practical resume improvement experience. Drawing on our experiences as students, interns, graduate teaching assistants and now as software engineers/mentors, we will share our insights on resume formatting, structure, and project descriptions. The session will be hands-on, with examples and general guidance provided to facilitate immediate improvements. Attendees will be encouraged to apply these suggestions to their own resumes during the workshop. The primary goal is for participants to acquire general resume-building knowledge and begin implementing it right away. This workshop is designed for tech students and early career professionals.

session_name: Connecting Machine Learning and Materials Science at 3M
description: 3M applies science in collaborative ways to improve lives daily; and a career in its corporate R&D has offered a multitude of opportunities to connect 3M's core technologies, such as adhesives, nonwovens, and optical films, with machine learning to create new solutions for display devices, anti-counterfeiting, optical metamaterials, and beyond. This session will showcase examples of combining material and digital technologies, while highlighting themes of key considerations for applied science, human intelligence and artificial intelligence, and what remains to be discovered in machine learning for materials science.

session_name: AI Fluency for Every Function: Skills That Drive Adoption
Building Trustworthy AI Products: A Cross-Functional Perspective from Product, Science, UX, and Engineering Stakeholders
speaker_name(s): Kelsy Foulstone, Shreya Chakrabarti, Aditi Asthana, Suganya Nagarajan, Lauren Paul

session_name: Building Your Professional Story: Creating an Executive Portfolio That Opens Doors
description: In today's competitive tech landscape, effectively communicating your professional journey is crucial for career advancement. This session provides a practical framework for creating a comprehensive executive portfolio, using my journey from tech support to AWS Senior Specialty Account Executive as a case study. Drawing from experience that secured speaking opportunities at major tech conferences and leadership roles at IBM, Cisco, and AWS, I'll share strategies for structuring your professional story, quantifying achievements, incorporating personal brand differentiators, and creating impactful visual elements. Attendees will receive templates and actionable steps to create their own powerful executive portfolio, particularly valuable for mid-career technologists advancing to senior leadership positions or increasing industry visibility through speaking engagements.

session_name: COBOL in the Modern World: Why This Legacy Language Still Matters
description: COBOL(Common Business-Oriented Language), one of the earliest programming languages, still quietly powers critical systems in finance, government, and healthcare. Yet as experienced developers retire, we face a serious talent gap that could jeopardize these foundational infrastructures. This session introduces COBOL in a modern context—no prior experience needed. Attendees will learn to read and write basic COBOL, understand its role in today's tech ecosystem, and explore how to modernize legacy systems responsibly. This session is a tribute to Grace Hopper's groundbreaking work and a call to action for the next generation to sustain and evolve her legacy—by stepping into a space where they're urgently needed.

session_name: CVS Health: Transforming Consumer Health Care Experience Through Technology
description: In today's fragmented health care landscape, consumers expect simplicity, personalization, and seamless access to care. This breakout session explores how CVS Health is bringing together Artificial Intelligence, digital innovation and human-centered care to reimagine the experience of Aetna members and CVS Pharmacy customers. Join us to learn how we are empowering consumers to navigate their health journeys with confidence and making it simple to access the care they need when they need it.

session_name: GenAI Productivity & Proficiency for Technologists
description: Discover how GenAI is transforming everyday workflows and supercharging productivity across roles. This session explores practical, high-impact use cases that resonate with a broad employee base— automating documentation, summarizing meetings, and enhancing communication. We'll then dive deeper into advanced applications tailored for technologists, including test code generation, design ideation, and product prototyping. Whether you're a developer, product designer, or tech leader, you'll leave with actionable insights and tools to boost your GenAI proficiency and drive innovation in your teams.

session_name: Hands-On Threat Modeling: A Practical Workshop to Secure Your Product
description: Shift from reactive security to proactive defense in this hands-on threat modeling workshop. You won't just hear about threat modeling; you'll do it. We'll guide you step-by-step through deconstructing a system, identifying potential threats, documenting your findings, and brainstorming effective mitigations. Learn a practical, repeatable process based on real-world application, empowering you to uncover vulnerabilities before attackers do. Walk away with the skills and confidence to implement threat modeling for your own products, fostering a stronger security posture. Ideal for engineers, architects, and PMs who want to build more secure software through practical application.

session_name: How to Craft a Winning Career Narrative That Sticks, Speaks, and Sells in a World of Constant Change
description: In a world of AI disruption, evolving tech stacks, and constant reinvention, the professionals who stand out aren't just the most skilled—they're the most story-ready. We remember people by their stories, not their resumes. So, how do you craft a career narrative that not only gets you hired, but also makes people remember, advocate for, and believe in you? In this tactical, hands-on session, technologist and storyteller Trishala Pillai walks you through a career-mapping framework designed to help you extract the patterns, lessons, and power of your unique professional journey—using the psychology of how humans process and remember information. You'll learn how to reverse-engineer job descriptions, identify narrative patterns in your timeline, and create versions of your story for interviews, networking, and everyday career conversations.

session_name: Internship Chronicles: Level Up Every Internship from Day One
description: Ever wrapped up an internship wondering, "Did that even count?" Join two recent grads—one who interned at Apple, one at Uber—as we spill the secrets to turning every co-op/internship stint into a launchpad for your career. You'll discover how to: Set Expectations Early: Craft clear goals with your mentor so you know exactly what success looks like. Earn Stretch Assignments: The art of volunteering for high-impact tasks without overpromising. Document Your Wins: Build a living "artifact vault" (diagrams, code snippets, test results) that showcases impact Bullet-Proof Resume: Transform those deliverables into compelling, metrics-driven bullets that recruiters can't ignore. Reflect & Showcase: Use a simple journaling framework and end-of-term demo to maximize learning—and visibility. Whether you're a first-time intern or lining up your next co-op, this interactive workshop will equip you with a repeatable playbook and elevate your post-grad opportunities.

session_name: Jeepers! Why isn't Agile working for our team?
description: The Mystery Machine gang each have their own unique quirks and responsibilities '96 just like an Agile team! This presentation will help you unmask the mystery of how behavioral patterns can impact the whole team and how to remedy them to get back on track. We'll talk about the Agile team structure (in terms of the Scooby Squad) and their individual responsibilities for some context before diving into how they could be inadvertently preventing the team's success. In true problem-solving fashion, we'll uncover the root cause of each behavior and how to avoid it in the future. No need to say "ru-roh," this presentation will help the whole team work together better.

session_name: Leveling the Playing Field: Fair Scoring and Inclusion in Tech & Education
description: Standardized exams like the GRE or SAT often run in different sessions, each with varying question difficulty, raising fairness concerns. This research introduces a statistical method to adjust scores based on test difficulty. By calculating a difficulty index for each test version—based on participant performance—we apply a correction factor to adjust raw scores. Simulations show that this method produces more balanced, equitable results than traditional scoring, leveling the field for all test-takers. The approach is practical, scalable, and ensures fairness regardless of exam slot. This method can also be extended to academic grading, where course difficulty varies. For example, two students scoring 85% in different subjects—one in advanced physics, the other in an easier elective—would be evaluated more fairly by accounting for difficulty. This research supports a more just system in both standardized testing and academic assessment.

session_name: Mastering Prompt Engineering: Use ChatGPT as an Analyst
description: This session dives into prompt engineering — the new literacy for working with large language models (LLMs). Learn how to shape AI responses to extract insights, automate tasks, and generate structured output. We'll explore real-world use cases, from research and content creation to data analysis. You'll gain practical strategies like role-based prompts, prompt chaining, and troubleshooting techniques to make ChatGPT a powerful tool in your workflow.
speaker_name(s): Sri Harshitha Gollamudi, Satya Bhargavi, Satya Chandana Snehal Mattaparti

session_name: NEXT-Level Leadership: A Fireside Chat with Rebecca Parsons & Ashley Johnson
description: Join Rebecca Parsons and Ashley Johnson for a candid fireside chat on their rise to the C-suite and board leadership. This capstone session wraps up our masterclass series and offers a glimpse into the kind of executive growth explored in the NEXT program.
speaker_name(s): Rebecca Parsons, Jeanette Jordan, Ashley Johnson

session_name: Observability for DevOps Success in Cloud-Native Systems
description: In cloud-native systems, observability is more than monitoring. This session explores how metrics, logs, traces, and events empower teams to detect issues, investigate incidents, and secure containerized environments, including Kubernetes. This session is ideal for DevOps engineers or SREs, looking to enhance visibility and stability in their DevOps pipelines and/or Kubernetes cluster while also growing their cloud skillset. Through real-world examples and dashboards from Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI), attendees will gain practical skills and insights to build secure, resilient, and automated systems using observability as a core DevOps capability.

session_name: Recharge Your Energy to Fuel Your Productivity
description: In both our personal and professional lives, we're often juggling competing priorities, tight deadlines, and nonstop demands. With so much on our plates, it's easy to fall into a pattern of running at full speed for long stretches without pausing to rest or reflect. While this may feel productive in the short term, over time it leads to stress, exhaustion, and ultimately burnout. To maintain our mental health and overall well-being, it's essential to find ways to regularly recharge our batteries. This is easier said than done. Recharging doesn't look the same for everyone; what restores one person may not work for another. Likewise, the signs that we're nearing depletion can vary widely from person to person. Join us to: Understand the connection between stress, energy, and overall well-being Explore your personal relationship with stress and identify your early warning signs Learn simple, realistic strategies to recharge, especially when time is limited

session_name: Redesigning the Tech Talent Pipeline
description: Join Linda Calvin, Western Governors University's School of Technology vice president and dean for the department of cybersecurity, cloud and IT, for a discussion of the talent gap, importance of education in tech-related fields, the scorecard for diversity, and how companies can rethink talent pipeline development to meet gap needs for emerging tech. Former chief impact officer for Reboot Representation and founder of Indiana Women IN Tech Week, Linda will also outline the importance of women staying the course and finding a mentor to progress in tech fields.

session_name: Responsible AI and Human Capital: What Every Leader Needs to Know
description: AI-enabled human capital tools are all the rage. Promising faster results with fewer resources, employers are rapidly adopting AI-integrated human capital tools, such as resume sorters and AI-enabled note-taking, at a rapid pace. But have business leaders really considered what they're getting with these shiny new AI-tools? Research shows that most AI models not only replicate but exacerbate existing social biases along racial, gender, and age lines. Without thoughtful consideration, companies may be introducing a new layer of machine-enabled discrimination into their people processes by incorporating AI tools into their human capital strategy. This session seeks to clarify what business leaders need to consider when adopting AI human capital tools and offer solutions to debias and derisk systems.

session_name: Shield Up: Building Unbreakable AWS Infrastructure Against DDoS Attacks
description: Imagine your AWS infrastructure as a fortress '96 but what happens when it faces a tsunami of malicious traffic? This session reveals the battle-tested blueprint for defending your cloud against DDoS attacks. We'll demonstrate how to build an ironclad defense system by combining AWS Shield's automatic protection with Web Application Firewall's smart filtering, all while leveraging CloudFront's global edge network. You'll learn how to architect your infrastructure to absorb and deflect attacks through strategic use of Auto Scaling, multi-region deployment, and intelligent load balancing. Whether you're facing volumetric floods, protocol exploits, or sophisticated application-layer attacks, you'll walk away with practical, immediately applicable strategies to protect your AWS environment. Perfect for security engineers, and DevOps professionals who want to sleep better at night knowing their infrastructure is secure against the internet's biggest threat.

session_name: Starting Your Own Culture Team: Empowering Others to Make an Impact
description: Building a strong, inclusive workplace culture doesn't happen overnight, it takes intention, persistence, and people who care. In this session, I'll share my 5+ year journey of launching and growing a culture team at Microsoft. From gaining leadership support to organizing meaningful initiatives, I'll Walk through the wins, the lessons, and the challenges of driving cultural change from within.

session_name: The Power of the Pause: Living with Intention in Hustle Culture
description: In a world that celebrates speed, output, and perpetual motion, hitting "pause" can feel like failure. But what if stepping back is actually the most powerful move you can make?

session_name: Unleashing Superpowers: Designing for Equity, Agency & Innovation in Tech
description: We are living in a time of extraordinary disruption—and possibility. As AI, automation, and digital systems evolve, so must our approach to leadership, inclusion, and innovation. But what if the greatest source of transformation isn't technology itself—but the people shaping it? This session introduces a strengths-based Superpower Framework that reimagines leadership through the lens of identity, lived experience, and personal resilience. Participants will discover their unique "superpowers"—like empathy, pattern recognition, curiosity, and problem-solving—and learn how to activate them in tech spaces. Through interactive reflection, visual mapping, and a guided self-assessment, attendees will explore how to identify their strengths, build inclusive teams, and lead with authenticity. This session offers a fresh lens on power and purpose—designed to affirm diverse experiences and redefine what it means to thrive in tech.

session_name: What Were They Thinking? A Journey Through Decision Making with ADRs
description: Have you ever gone back to review your code from six months ago and wondered "what was I thinking"? One of the hardest things to track during a project is the motivation behind why certain decisions were made. This leads to future developers either blindly accepting or rejecting previous decisions. Through this workshop, you can learn a process to document design decisions in an efficient, structured manner using Architecture Design Records (ADRs). In this workshop, participants will learn about a position management system and work through making system design changes to it. As in a real workplace, requirements will change over time. We will navigate this by referring back to the initial ADR and making necessary changes to subsequent ADR versions. This workshop is intended for early and mid-career engineers. Through it, engineers will learn how to increase transparency of decisions, maintain architectural consistency, and make better informed architectural decisions.
speaker_name(s): Navya Shree Nagendra Rao, Tanvi Haldankar

session_name: Why talking about female health made us better at work - a deep dive into navigating the 3Ms
description: After a successful series of open discussions in person and online about Menstruation, Motherhood and Menopause, we have put together a formal talk for a wider audience. The talk will include our personal stories of women's health - focusing on fertility, loss and menopause against the backdrop of being women in a male dominated tech world. How it might feel to flood out during a meeting, to be supporting direct reports whilst you are going through fertility treatment or worrying about being judged because you have a hot flush in the office are all common female health themes that many of us have experienced. How women can support each other to have the right conversations at the right time with their male counterparts, and how to prioritise self care will be covered as key topics. We will cover how we have navigated difficult personal issues whilst driving careers and how we have intentionally gone about creating supportive working networks will be a key focus area.

session_name: A case for going out of your comfort zone
description: This talk chronicles a transformative journey from the familiar landscape of software architecture to the dynamic realm of cloud security at Uber. Discover how the courage to step outside a well-defined comfort zone, coupled with Uber's commitment to diverse talent, continuous learning, and innovative thinking, fueled this exciting career transition. Beyond the professional growth, this session will explore the profound personal benefits of embracing discomfort, including increased risk-taking aptitude, enhanced self-confidence, and a strengthened belief in one's ability to master new skills. Learn how Uber's supportive environment empowered this unconventional career path and how the lessons learned extend far beyond the technical domain, offering valuable insights for anyone seeking personal and professional expansion.

session_name: Balancing Code and Coursework: Thriving in a Full-Time Job While Earning a Degree
description: In today's fast-moving tech industry, continued education is key to growth—whether you're stepping into leadership, shifting domains, or reigniting curiosity. But how do you balance a graduate or PhD program while working full-time? In this session, I'll share my experience as a software engineer at Amazon pursuing a hybrid Master's in Engineering Management. From late-night assignments to finding time for rest and relationships, I'll walk through real challenges and practical strategies that helped me stay grounded. This talk challenges the notion that women in tech must choose between career and education. It's a call to go Unbound—beyond timelines, perfectionism, or single definitions of success. Attendees will leave with mindset shifts, time-tested tools, and a flexible roadmap to thrive on this ambitious dual path.

session_name: Creating Calm in the Chaos: Strategies for Better Collaboration
description: In fast-paced product teams, chaos often feels unavoidable—misaligned roadmaps, async overload, clashing personalities, and shifting priorities. This session shares real-world rituals, frameworks, and inclusive practices we've used to bring clarity, trust, and cohesion to global product teams at scale. You'll learn how to design async critiques, use North Star documents for alignment, and run inclusive design jams that honor different voices—introverts, early-career members, and senior leaders alike. We'll share metrics from teams where meeting time dropped 35% and delivery improved by 26%, thanks to intentional collaboration. Whether you're a PM, designer, or team lead, walk away with practical templates and strategies to create psychological safety, boost team clarity, and drive product outcomes—without burning out.

session_name: Designing for humans in an AI-native future
description: We are entering a new age of exploration, where AI agents will not just assist us—they will act on our behalf, making purchasing decisions and navigating the digital world for us. This new reality doesn't change fundamental human needs; it sharpens their importance. Whether you're in design, product, or engineering, your greatest value will be your ability to direct AI to solve strategic problems, freeing you up to focus on creativity, empathy, and leadership. Join me to explore our playbook for winning in an AI-native world by transforming our industry, empowering our workforce, and designing radically new customer experiences.

session_name: Engineering in the Age of Gen-AI: Redefining Roles, Skills, and Leadership
description: As generative AI and automation reshape the software landscape, engineering is undergoing a profound identity shift. The future will not just belong to those who write code—but to those who understand how to apply, adapt, and lead with it. This session explores how Gen-AI is changing the very nature of engineering work—and what today's leaders must do to prepare their teams for what's next. Key topics include: Code as leverage, not just output: Why future-ready engineers will be defined by problem-solving, systems thinking, and product fluency. The rise of the engineering curator: How AI copilots shift focus from writing code to designing and validating the right solutions. New leadership responsibilities: Guiding teams through uncertainty, driving upskilling, and fostering ethical literacy around AI use. Reimagining team roles: What automation means for junior developers, QA, SRE, and the full software lifecycle.

session_name: From Instability to Insight: Modeling Geopolitical Risk
description: In an era where headlines shift markets and global tensions drive business strategy, understanding geopolitical risk is no longer optional '96 it is essential. But how do we move beyond gut instinct and expert opinion? This session will dive into the cutting-edge world of data modeling for geopolitical risk analysis. It will look at ways in which we are leveraging quantitative tools to transform how we forecast conflict, assess instability and navigate an ever more volatile world.

session_name: From Reactive to Agentic: Real-World Enterprise AI Case Studies in Cybersecurity
description: The rise of large language models has ushered in the age of agentic AI—systems that can reason, plan, and take action using tools. In this session, you'll learn how these systems are transforming NVIDIA cybersecurity operations through two real-world use cases: automated server alert triage and software vulnerability analysis. We'll explore how agents reduce the human toil of reacting to alerts and vulnerabilities by conducting investigations, analyzing data, and generating structured reports. Along the way, you'll learn how to choose the right system architecture for the job, from fixed paths to fully adaptive agents, and why hybrid designs often strike the best balance. We'll also share lessons from the field: the importance of designing with users in mind, defining success early, and starting simple with quick iterations. Whether you're in cybersecurity or any other field, you'll leave with practical insights and fresh inspiration to bring agentic AI to life in your own work!

session_name: From Rejection to Realization: How Failure Landed Me My Dream Job at Disney
description: Failure isn't the end — sometimes, it's the beginning. In this talk, I'll share my messy, very human journey from academic probation and job rejections to becoming a recruiter at The Walt Disney Company. From moving states and losing my dad to flunking out and burning out, I'll unpack the moments that nearly broke me — and the lessons that helped me rebuild. Through humor, honesty, and heart, this session reframes failure as fuel. Whether you're pivoting careers, feeling stuck, or navigating rejection, consider this a love letter to late bloomers, comeback stories, and the unexpected paths that still lead to dream jobs. Tattoos, ghost blouses, breakdowns — all welcome. Key Takeaways: Reframe rejection as redirection Tools to bounce back from setbacks with purpose How vulnerability can elevate your tech career Proof that nonlinear paths still lead to success

session_name: From Serving Tables to Serving Users: The Path to Product Management
description: From serving tables at my parents' 12-table restaurant—where I crafted makeshift chopsticks so a little guest could proudly join her family's meal, and redesigned our clunky website using insights gathered through casual conversations with customers scrolling our menu on their phones to place to-go orders—to researching real estate markets, and now shipping products at Microsoft, I discovered product management isn't about a CS degree or "PM" in your title. It's a mindset rooted deeply in empathy, honed through every interaction. Each rubber-banded chopstick taught me to anticipate unspoken needs; each website tweak fueled scrappy innovation grounded on customer feedback; each real market analysis sharpened my ability to align stakeholders and make data-driven decisions. You'll leave with a practical guide to spot, refine, and showcase your transferable skills—and proof that anyone who's solved customer problems through empathy can thrive in product management.

session_name: Governance Meets Code: Operationalizing Ethics in AI Use Cases
description: In this engaging session, we'll explore the evolving landscape of ethical considerations in Generative AI and how these principles are being actively applied within Experian. Tailored for technology leaders and professionals, this session explores key ethical challenges: bias, transparency, accountability, and data privacy, and how Experian addresses them in practice. We will showcase real use cases and a prototype demo, revealing how Experian embeds ethical principles into AI solutions like credit risk modeling and customer engagement. Key Takeaways: '95tCore ethical principles in GenAI '95tExperian's approach to responsible AI '95tReal-world applications and outcomes '95tPrototype demo of ethical AI in action '95tFrameworks for ethical AI adoption Whether you're a C-suite executive, a technology leader, or a culture champion, this session will equip you with insights and frameworks to navigate the intersection of AI innovation and ethical responsibility.

session_name: Green Pods: Architecting Sustainable and Responsible Kubernetes Solutions for a Better Tomorrow
Rigorous Qualitative Human-Centered Methods for CHIPS & Science Act Broadening Participation Mandate
description: This talk will explore how to meet requirements of 2022's CHIPS (Creating Helpful Incentives to Produce Semiconductors) and Science Act. There is a need to "ensure collaboration and coordination across federal agencies, the private sector, and with state and local governments to facilitate timely and effective reviews of all federally-funded projects." One mandate includes "measures of the institution's ability to attract and retain a diverse and nontraditional student population in the fields of science, technology, engineering, and mathematics, which may include the ability to attract women, minorities, and individuals with disabilities." This criterion is needed by organizations that hire and wish to retain graduates enabled by this act. This public policy evolution of Indi Young's listening sessions methodology adapts a rigorous method to include aspects relevant to public sector work. Those working in both the public and private sectors will find this methodology useful.

session_name: Securing the SaaS Supply Chain: A Practical Approach
Stopping Bad Actors: How Tech Tackles Fraud and Abuse at Scale
description: In an era where digital platforms underpin everything from financial transactions to social engagement, fraud and abuse have emerged as sophisticated, fast-evolving threats. This session explores the real-world impact of fraud and abuse in digital ecosystems and outlines cutting-edge strategies to detect, mitigate, and prevent these threats. Attendees will learn how companies are leveraging behavioral analytics, machine learning, and proactive security design to stay ahead of bad actors—while ensuring that their approaches meet increasingly stringent compliance and data protection standards. We'll showcase practical techniques for identifying risky behaviors, enforcing security at the API layer, and maintaining the delicate balance between user experience and safety. This session is a must-attend for security professionals, compliance leaders, engineers and product teams looking to strengthen their fraud prevention strategies while preserving trust and regulatory alignment.

session_name: Switch, Rest, Succeed: A Tech Guide to Thriving After Career Change
description: Career changes promise fresh starts—but they don't erase burnout, insecurity, or the grief of leaving a field you once loved. After years at the lab bench, I jumped from immunology research to machine-learning engineering, convinced a brand-new domain would fix everything. Instead, I met a perfect storm of imposter syndrome, perfectionism, and 24/7 worry—until therapy and deliberate self-care taught me that productivity without rest is unsustainable. In this candid, fast-paced talk, I unpack the hidden emotional costs of "reinvention," reveal how painful detours can become superpowers, and share science-backed habits that help brains (and careers) flourish. You'll leave knowing no time is wasted, every skill is transferable, and mental health is the real performance upgrade.

This session explores the raw and real experience of navigating early motherhood while working in tech—especially as a remote employee during a return-to-office era. Through personal stories and actionable strategies, attendees will learn how to stay visible, maintain performance, and protect their well-being in a system that often overlooks caregivers. Perfect for working moms, allies, and leaders committed to inclusion and retention in STEM.

session_name: Usable Security 'f3 Bridging Research and Industry Practice
description: Security is only as effective as its usability. Yet, designing security features that users can understand, trust, and properly engage with remains a persistent challenge. This talk dives into the principles of usable security — the intersection of human-computer interaction and security — and how these principles translate from academic research into real-world product development. Drawing on her Ph.D. research and over a decade of industry experience at Google and Snowflake, Iulia Ion will guide attendees through the core tenets of usable security, including user-centered design, transparency, minimal user burden, and contextual trust. Iulia will discuss the practical realities of applying usable security principles within fast-paced engineering organizations. This session is ideal for software engineers, security practitioners, product managers, and UX designers interested in designing secure systems that users can actually use effectively.

session_name: Women in Tech: Shaping the Future of Financial Well-Being
Life's Too Short for Mundane Tasks: Let LLM Agents Revolutionize Your Processes
description: As AI becomes increasingly integral to software development, the need for dynamic, intelligent process automation is growing. Traditional orchestration tools fall short when workflows require reasoning and adaptation. LangGraph is an open-source framework that extends LangChain to build stateful, multi-agent systems powered by language models. In this hands-on workshop, we explore how LangGraph empowers developers to create language-model based workflows using a graph structure. We will demonstrate how LangGraph simplifies the orchestration of autonomous agents, handles branching logic and memory, and enables coordination across tasks such as document processing, decision-making, and human-in-the-loop review. Participants will learn to build, debug, and evaluate agentic applications using LangGraph. We'll explore defining custom agents, managing flow control through graph edges, and handling state transitions where human input, model reasoning, and external tools intersect.
speaker_name(s): Anagha Rumade, Apoorva Jaiswal, Anjana Umapathy

session_name: Modeling a GraphQL service on AWS: A Hands-on Workshop
description: This presentation will focus on demonstrating GraphQL capabilities through a small-scale proof of concept using AWS AppSync. The session will showcase fundamental GraphQL operations, including query and mutation implementations, along with real-time notification features. The demonstration will utilize AppSync as the GraphQL service layer, with Lambda functions handling the business logic. For messaging and notifications, the architecture will incorporate SQS and SNS, while DynamoDB will serve as the persistent data store. Designed to be beginner-friendly, this workshop will help attendees familiarize themselves with AWS concepts while learning practical GraphQL implementation strategies. Participants will learn how GraphQL can simplify data access across multiple facets and datasets, using a real-world pricing domain example that demonstrates how to streamline complex data management scenarios.

In this practical, experience-driven session, we'll dive deep into the architecture and implementation of distributed systems that operate at massive scale. Through real-world case studies and battle-tested patterns, attendees will learn how to design, build, and maintain systems that reliably serve millions of users. Real-world examples from how we do it at Amazon

session_name: Tails of Kafka: How Pets Stream the Tea
description: tolerant event streaming for real-time analytics to microservice communication. In this beginner-friendly workshop, we'll demystify Kafka with real time data from gossip-loving cats via Kafka topics, producers and consumers. We'll introduce the core concepts including brokers, partitions, consumer groups and message offsets and dive into resiliency with Kafka. Participants will run kafka labs sending and receiving real-time pet drama. We will also discuss how adopting event streaming technologies enhances operational efficiency and supports innovation in various industries. By using real-world scenarios, we will demonstrate how Kafka addresses significant business needs, enabling organizations to remain competitive in a rapidly evolving landscape.
speaker_name(s): Rosie Wang, Sarah Orsak, Theresa Wright

session_name: Breaking barriers in your tech career
description: From not seeing other faces that look like ours in leadership roles to dealing with self-limiting beliefs, stereotypes and biases, women face unique barriers to success in our technology careers. In this talk, which is both inspiring and practical, I will teach women how to break every internal and external barrier by intentionally picking an empowering response to a disempowering barrier. As as a first-generation college graduate with a bachelor's degree in computer science from University of Wisconsin-LaCrosse, an immigrant from humble beginnings and a single mother of my 2 children since they were 2 and 4, I had to learn how to break many internal and external barriers to became one of the highest-ranking women of color at IBM. The audience will learn how to show their worth instead of giving their power away to the barriers. They will also learn what truly matters when scaling the technology leadership ladder. They will become unbound and show up as leaders and role models.

session_name: Breaking into Product Management: From Curiosity to Career
description: Product Management (PM) is rapidly growing in visibility and influence across industries, serving as the nexus between business goals, user needs, and technical execution. However, many aspiring professionals struggle to understand how to enter this field, especially without a traditional background in tech, business, or design. This presentation offers a comprehensive, insider perspective on how to successfully break into product management, covering real-world career paths, skill-building strategies, and industry expectations. Attendees will leave with a clear understanding of the PM role, a personal action plan, and the confidence to pursue or transition into this exciting field.

session_name: Build Your Own AI Promotion Coach: A Hands-On Multi-Agent Workshop
description: Ever wish you had a personal coach to help you get promoted? Now you can build one. In this hands-on, beginner-friendly workshop, you'll learn how multi-agent systems can reduce hallucinations, increase trust, and guide users through high-stakes scenarios like promotion planning. Drawing from real-world lessons in enterprise AI development, co-facilitators Ishween Kaur and Uma Uppin will help you build your own AI Promotion Coach, a multi-agent chatbot powered by LLM APIs that breaks down vague ladders, crafts accomplishment summaries, and generates advocacy scripts. No deep ML experience required just curiosity and basic Python. You'll walk away with a working prototype, a new perspective on agent design, and practical trust-building patterns you can use in your own AI projects.

session_name: Career MVPs: Small Experiments, Smart Career Moves
Cybersecurity That Saves Lives: A Behind-the-Scenes Look at Digital Defense
description: Cybercrime is a trillion-dollar industry threatening everything from daily conveniences to national security. As a result, cybersecurity is one of the most mission-critical, fast-growing areas in tech. Yet the global shortage of cybersecurity professionals continues to grow, especially among women and nonbinary technologists. In this inspiring session, two women technologists join forces to share how their work helps stop threats before they spread. We'll walk through a real-world cyberattack, how it could have been prevented, and how your skills can shape a safer digital future.

session_name: Data Governance in Practice: Driving Business Results and AI Accountability
description: Data governance is often seen as policy-heavy or too technical. When put in practice, it keeps data usable, trustworthy, and aligned with business goals. It plays a central role in ensuring AI systems are built and used responsibly. Many organizations recognize the importance of data governance but struggle to move beyond policies and tool selection. The challenge is figuring out how to make it work in a fast-paced, cross-functional environment. Without a clear operational model, governance efforts stall, leading to poor data quality, unclear accountability, and increased risk in AI initiatives. This hands on workshop focuses on execution. Attendees will learn how to integrate data governance into daily business operations, where it can deliver real impact. Data Professionals and Executives will build practical data governance programs that support business priorities and reduce risk in AI initiatives.

session_name: Designing for Scale: Tech and Culture Decisions That Last
description: In the ever evolving and changing software development environment, the pressure to deliver quickly and reuse what we have can lead to decisions that don't stand the test of scale or time. This session explores how to lead with a long-term mindset, sharing real-world lessons from designing and evolving scalable systems from technology and cultural aspects. We will explore frameworks for making high-impact architectural decisions, how to balance short-term delivery needs with sustainable growth, and how to guide teams toward building resilient, maintainable systems that last.

session_name: Edge AI, Secured: Protecting Secrets in Disconnected Kubernetes Clusters
description: As AI workloads move to the edge—powering autonomous systems, smart manufacturing, and remote healthcare—securing sensitive data and models in disconnected environments is critical. Traditional cloud-based security models often fall short. This session explores vulnerabilities in edge AI deployments and features a live demo of real-world attacks and modern defenses. We'll examine how Kubernetes clusters at the edge can maintain strong security postures without constant cloud connectivity. Topics include zero-trust architectures, hardware-rooted trust (TPM, HSM), secrets encryption, policy enforcement, and container runtime protections. We'll also cover best practices for securing ML models and inference data in containerized environments. Attendees will leave with practical strategies for building secure, resilient AI infrastructure at the edge—enabling innovation without compromising trust or compliance.

session_name: Exploring Tech-Adjacent Careers— A No-Code Path to Success in Technology
description: Are you a soon-to-be or recent graduate or are you're a mid-career curious about thriving in tech without writing code every day? Join us for an insightful session that unveils the diverse and dynamic world of tech-adjacent roles—career paths that leverage your technical background while focusing on skills beyond programming. We'll explore exciting no-code opportunities These roles play a critical part in the technology ecosystem, bridging gaps between engineering, customers, and business. You'll learn what these roles entail, the skills needed to succeed, and how to navigate your career journey toward these impactful positions. Whether you're passionate about technology but want to apply your talents in communication, coordination, or strategic growth, this session will empower you with actionable insights and inspiration to chart your unique path in tech. Come discover how to build a successful, fulfilling tech career that aligns with your strengths and interests—no coding required!
speaker_name(s): Liza Ogwel, Ayleen Kim, Rachel Leekin

session_name: From Config to Confidence: Scaling Safe Rollouts and Experiments at Uber with Flipr
description: What happens when a config change accidentally disables payments in 50+ countries? At Uber's scale, changes must be made with precision. Enter Flipr — Uber's dynamic config and experimentation platform powering safe rollouts across 700+ services and 50K+ hosts. Flipr lets teams deploy features using rule-based configs (by geography, user, app version, etc.) without code changes, with support for real-time rollbacks, audits, and compliance gating. Built on top is Experiments, enabling A/B tests with real-time metrics via XP Monitoring. We'll share examples: how dispatch teams tune city-wise ETAs, how payments safely roll out methods, and how compliance blocks features dynamically — all without deploys. Learn how Flipr empowers teams to ship faster, experiment safely, and scale with confidence including Flipr's design, scaling challenges, and real-world use in dispatch, payments, and experimentation. Detailed overview and outline for the session are available in the linked doc.

session_name: From Features to Finances - A PM'eds Guide to Capturing Business Value
description: Many PMs build great products but struggle to show how they move the business forward. The true challenge lies in translating those products into tangible business value. This session delves into the concept of value capture- the process of converting products into business value. Through real-world examples, we'll explore how strategic decisions in monetization, pricing, customer segmentation, can significantly impact a product's profitability. Attendees will gain insights to: 1) Understand the distinction between value creation and value capture in product management. 2) Identify key strategies and frameworks for capturing business value from products. 3)Apply real-world examples to inform strategic product decisions that align with business goals. By the end of this session, participants will be equipped with actionable strategies to ensure their products not only meet user needs but also drive business success.

session_name: From Imposter to Impact: Thriving in Your First Tech Role
description: Starting your first full-time role in tech can feel like entering a maze—with no map, no compass, and the looming weight of imposter syndrome. From deciphering unspoken workplace norms to figuring out how to speak up in meetings or ask for feedback, it's easy to feel overwhelmed and alone. In this candid and practical session, we as early-career engineers share our journeys of growth, missteps, and breakthroughs. With real talk and real tools, we'll explore how to navigate the transition from student to professional, find your voice, and grow into a confident, impactful contributor. Whether you're in your first role or preparing for one, this talk will equip you with tangible strategies to thrive—not just survive—in your early tech career. You'll walk away with: Confidence-building tools to combat imposter syndrome Strategies to create visibility & demonstrate value in your team Lessons in navigating feedback, growth plans, & goal setting Building a support system (mentorship & more)

session_name: Lost in the AI Boom? How to Reclaim Your Space in Tomorrow'eds Tech
description: With AI dominating headlines and transforming the way we work, it's easy to feel like you're falling behind. If you've ever asked yourself, "Do I still fit in?" — you're not alone. This talk is a grounded, honest conversation about belonging in the AI era—for developers, designers, product managers, and anyone feeling overwhelmed by the pace of change. You don't need to be an expert in machine learning to be part of tech's future—you just need to start.

session_name: Mastering Negotiation Skills: Empowering Women for Success
description: Navigating negotiations in a male-dominated field can be daunting. Yet, it's crucial to everything that matters in your career '96 promotions and career growth, gaining access to resources for peak performance, navigating work-life balance, and dismantling stereotypes. Mastering the art of negotiation is not just a career skill—it's a catalyst for personal empowerment and confidence for women in the workplace. This confidence emboldens the individual, paves the way for an equitable and inclusive work environment, and inspires women to embark on and excel in tech careers. Join this workshop to learn how to be an effective negotiator and practice your skills in a supportive environment. Together, we'll debunk myths, develop strategies for compelling arguments, and walk through successful negotiation strategies. Empower yourself to navigate negotiations confidently and shape your tech career.

session_name: Navigating a Dual Career- Tech Professional & Content Creator
description: Many women in tech feel pressure to choose between technical excellence and personal passions. In this session, I'll share how I've built a thriving career at AWS while growing a social media presence as a content creator with 50k+ followers. I'll discuss how I've translated technical storytelling into digital influence, navigated time management, avoided burnout, and found synergy between my dual identities. This session is for those wondering if they have to "pick a lane," and encourages attendees to see how diverse skillsets can elevate—not distract from—a successful tech career.

session_name: Sane by Design: How to build a Self-Care system in digital world
description: Ever found yourself answering Slack with one hand while microwaving your third coffee with the other—wondering if this is peak performance or just peak survival? This session is for high-achievers crushing deadlines but quietly crashing inside. Drawing from my own journey through weight loss, depression and burnout, while building high-impact products at Uber and Flipkart, I'll share how I applied Product Management principles of prioritization, feedback loops, and user empathy (with me as the user) to build a self-care system. You'll walk away with a framework to protect your energy, how to build a self-care stack suited to you, and doable rituals that fit even the most chaotic calendars. This isn't about quitting tech and moving to the mountains—it's about staying in the game without burning out. Come redefine success—where you feel good and get things done. Because, self-care isn't a break it is our secret weapon.

session_name: Security - Secret Management Platform
description: At Uber, we run over 5,000 microservices, 5,000 databases, and over 500,000 analytical jobs per day and over 150,000 secrets facilitate authentication among these large, distributed ecosystems with multiple stakeholders. Cyberattacks continue to rise industry-wide, with exposed credentials being a leading cause. With this in mind, we set out on a mission to build a centralized, automated, and scalable solution for secrets management. To combat secrets sprawl, shadow IT vaults, and insecure secret sharing, and to facilitate the rotation of secrets when necessary, we kicked off a transformative journey building a Secret Management Platform. We assembled a set of thought leaders within the company to define Uber's Secret Management Standard and a visionary solution. In this presentation, I'll share how we built Uber's Secret Management Platform, solving key challenges and setting a new standard for secrets management.

session_name: Talk Money, Tell Stories, Make Moves: Leveling Up Your Career with Confidence and Connection
description: Pivoting into tech isn't always a straight line—and sometimes, it takes more than one pivot to land where you truly want to be. In this session, I'll share my journey of breaking into the tech industry after years of persistence, and how I made a second leap from a non-technical to a technical role at Uber. Along the way, I learned how to craft a compelling career story, build authentic connections, and negotiate for the salary and roles I deserved. Whether you're navigating a career change, preparing for your next big ask, or looking to grow your network with purpose, this session will give you actionable strategies—and a confidence boost—to help you make your next move with power and clarity.

session_name: Tech for Social Good in the Age of Generative AI: Designing for Equity, Accountability, and Impact
description: As technology reshapes every corner of society, we face a critical question: Can innovation be a force for justice, not just disruption? This session explores how technologists can drive Tech for Social Good — especially in the age of Generative AI (Gen-AI) — by building ethical, inclusive, and impact-driven systems. We'll examine how emerging technologies like Gen-AI are transforming access to education, healthcare, crisis response, and advocacy. But with that power comes responsibility: when AI generates content, decisions, or insights, whose values does it reflect — and who does it exclude? Through case studies, frameworks, and community centered strategies, this session will unpack: Gen-AI for Good: How AI is being used to support education, mental health and climate solutions Bias, Power and Policy: The social risks of AI tools Measuring Impact: Defining success beyond efficiency or engagement Cross-Sector Collaboration: Why tech, nonprofits, policy, and academia must align

session_name: Career Comeback: Navigating the Return to Professional Life
description: As an Amazon Technical Program Manager with 7 years of technical experience and an 8-year career break raising children, I've successfully navigated the challenging journey back to the workforce. In my 3+ years at Amazon, I've earned a promotion and transitioned from technical role to program management while balancing family life. Career breaks, whether from family commitments, relocation, or visa issues, can be daunting. This session presents a practical framework for workplace reintegration, focusing on: Confidence rebuilding Skill enhancement Market re-entry strategies Drawing from personal experience, I'll share actionable steps to transform career gaps into growth opportunities. My journey proves that with strategic planning, resilience, and proper support, success in tech leadership is achievable while maintaining work-life balance. Whether you're planning your return or already transitioning, join me to learn practical strategies for your next professional chapter.

session_name: Charting New Territories: Academia Meets Data & AI Strategy
description: Embark on a journey from organizational psychology to leading data and AI strategy at Manulife, a global insurance leader. This presentation unveils my unexpected transition, highlighting how academic insights in psychology have fueled innovative strategies that drive technological and organizational growth. Discover how my experiences in consulting and banking have shaped my strategic vision and execution in the rapidly evolving tech landscape. Attendees will learn about the power of interdisciplinary approaches, the value of data-driven decision-making, and the vital role of leadership in fostering an AI-enabled future. This session aims to inspire professionals from diverse backgrounds to harness their unique experiences, positioning themselves as leaders in the data and AI revolution. Join us to explore how your journey can redefine industry landscapes and drive transformative change.

session_name: Cloud Economics and Financial Management: A Strategic Imperative
description: Cloud computing has transformed business operations, creating new financial challenges that require executive attention. The shift from capital to operational expenditure demands new financial disciplines. Without proper management, cloud costs can spiral 20-50% higher than anticipated due to underestimated consumption, orphaned resources, and overprovisioning. This creates budget volatility affecting strategic planning and shareholder value. Effective cloud financial management serves as a strategic enabler. The FinOps framework brings together finance, technology, and business teams to manage cloud costs through three phases: Inform, Optimize, and Operate. Companies with mature cloud management practices typically achieve 20-30% cost savings while improving operational agility. This requires new governance models, automation tools, and organization-wide financial literacy. When properly implemented, cloud financial management becomes a strategic advantage.

session_name: Code-Switching Through Generations: Stories of Cultural Duality in Tech
description: Through personal stories of cultural duality, this session explores how navigating traditional values and modern tech identities shapes the experiences of underrepresented technologists. Attendees will reflect on themes of identity, belonging, and resilience in the workplace. Attendees will gain: '95 A better understanding of how culture influences behavior, communication, and collaboration '95 Practical ways to support cultural inclusion in tech teams '95 Renewed appreciation for the power of storytelling as a leadership and community-building tool

session_name: Docs Or It Didn't Happen - Writing A Design Document For A Future You
description: Have you ever struggled to determine the reasoning behind a particular system solution choice? What happens if it is a legacy system or the engineers who worked on it left the team or firm? Have you ever jumped straight into coding only to significantly change the implementation later? Design docs come to your rescue! They prompt system design discussions with your team and help identify shortcomings. A well-written design doc makes coding significantly easier, as it provides a step-by-step implementation roadmap. It should showcase architecture, diagram critical components, pros & cons of different solutions, tech stack, and data sources. Design docs are a true game changer! In this presentation, we will discuss how to write a design doc — structure, tips, and tricks. We will talk about how to find the right level of detail and how to provide clarity. We will then introduce a real life data-driven example and draft a design doc for it.

session_name: Emotional Intelligence For Success and Well-Being
description: Professional success requires more than just IQ and "hard" skills. In fact, research shows that emotional intelligence accounts for a majority of long-term success. It's the ability to be calm under pressure and resilient in the face of adversity. It's having a positive outlook and knowing how to attune to others. Come and learn how to increase your emotional intelligence so you can generate even greater success—for yourself and the people around you. With emotional resilience, you can do more than just survive'85 you can thrive! You'll learn techniques to be more positive, to calm down when stress rears its head, and develop more grit and resilience.

session_name: From Curious Girls to Confident Builders: Empowering the Next Generation of Technologists
description: We can't be what we can't see—yet millions of girls who are curious about technology never get the chance to see themselves as technologists. As woman in tech and a Solutions Architect's at AWS, We've seen firsthand the transformative power of visibility, mentorship, and early exposure. This session explores practical, scalable strategies to ignite interest in technology among girls from elementary school through high school—and keep them engaged. We will cover key areas like identifying what motivates girls to explore technology—and what often holds them back—so we can design experiences that truly resonate. Explore how to use AWS tools like Educate, Cloud Quest, and Code Whisperer to create hands-on, beginner-friendly projects that build both skills and confidence. We'll also talk about the power of storytelling and visible role models in helping girls see themselves in tech—and how you can use your own story to make a lasting impact

session_name: Get Funded! Breaking Barriers for Women Founders
description: Access to capital remains one of the greatest challenges for women entrepreneurs but it doesn't have to be. In this dynamic session, discover how women founders are challenging the status quo, securing funding, and building thriving, scalable businesses. Hear from an expert panel who share real-world insights on navigating bias, pitching with confidence, and leveraging networks and resources to unlock funding opportunities. Whether you're launching your first startup or preparing for your next investment round, this session will equip you with the tools, strategies, and inspiration to overcome barriers and get funded.
speaker_name(s): Pamela Lee, Veronica Michael, Jerome Edwards, Shana Cooper-Silas

session_name: Lessons from the Quiet Room: Rethinking How to Listen to Customers
description: Most Customer Advisory Boards (CABs) sound great on paper—but in practice, they become feedback theater or worse, a roadmap pitching ground. If you are thinking CABs are about talking to customers, that's the myth I want to debunk. It's about learning to listen differently. In this session, I'll share how I built and scaled a CAB for an enterprise product at Microsoft, and why it did NOT work—until I rewired it using lessons from Rob Fitzpatrick's The Mom Test and personal insights from how neurodiversity teaches us to communicate differently. What honest customer conversations actually sound like, i.e. not like a roadmap review, how to ask questions that invite truth instead of praise, and how to make silence your most strategic tool. Whether you're building B2B products or driving customer experience, you'll leave with actionable techniques to design more honest, insight-rich customer conversations—driving roadmap clarity, stakeholder alignment, and stronger customer relationships.

How many of you feel the subtle differences when you're on your period? Did you ever go into a guilt/denial phase, when you prioritized health over work? Did you overstress and felt guilty that you worsened your menstrual cycle? This is a sensitive topic for quite a few people who menstruate. Do you know that the stress is real? Do you know the cycle is your superpower if you work with it? You wear multiple hats at work, as a Software Engineer or any job profile in Tech. Get to know how to best sync your roles with the phases of your cycle! Let's bust some myths as I share how I trained myself to tune in with my cycle and made it my strength at work.

session_name: Oops, I Clicked: Behind the Scenes of Website Compromises
description: Have you ever wondered what's behind that suspicious link? In our chronically online world, we inevitably stumble upon malicious and compromised websites. How we react helps protect ourselves from malware downloads and personal information theft. This seminar offers a behind-the-scenes glimpse at common malware and phishing schemes, from initial click to action on objectives. Participants will view demonstrations of common website compromises they may encounter in the wild, and will learn how to reduce harm when encountering one of these compromised sites. Attendees will leave this session with actionable steps to defend themselves against malware threats, both proactively and in the heat of the moment.

session_name: Tales of a Neurodiverse Engineer
description: According to a HBS study, the unemployment rate for neurodiversity is as high as 80%. This talk explores a tale of an engineer who dealt with an undiagnosed disability while managing her workload while exploring the challenges of accommodations and support in the workplace as an engineer.

session_name: The Magic of Digital/Physical Convergence at Disney: Engineering Systems to Drive Data Insights
description: At Disney, magic isn't just created — it's engineered. In a world where digital and physical experiences are increasingly intertwined, it's essential to not only consider feature delivery, but also how to deliver innovation and insight at scale. Software system design, data, and business value can seem disjointed, as it is easy for a software engineer to build a system with solely the user experience in mind. But the data from these user interactions is equally important, and is essential for business strategy. Embedding this consumer understanding up front in system design can unlock immediate insights. There is a single Guest experience at Disney - one that traverses the digital and physical spaces. It takes technologists to power the magic and bring these experiences to life. This session highlights how understanding the Guest experience and the Parks business strategy informed the engineering and data design of an exciting new system in our parks.

session_name: The Unlikely Superpower: Turning a Non-Technical background into Tech success
Unlocking Cybersecurity: Launch Your Career and Debunk the Myths
description: Explore cybersecurity with this approachable guide designed for aspiring professionals! We will demystify the field, debunk common myths, and illustrate how diverse roles — from compliance to red, blue, purple teams, and security engineering — collaborate to protect our digital landscape. Explore abundant opportunities, understand key concepts, and visualize your potential career path through an end-to-end workflow. Whether you're considering a switch or just starting, this session will equip you with foundational knowledge and inspire confidence to launch your successful cybersecurity career.

session_name: Zero Downtime, Infinite Stakes: Case Study of Migration of LinkedIn'eds Authentication Databases
description: At large enterprises like LinkedIn, login is the gateway to everything. Behind this simple step is complex infrastructure that must reliably scale to billions of sessions while ensuring security, performance, and uptime. Over time, evolving this system—to cut costs, boost performance, or ditch legacy tech—makes database migrations essential. This talk covers LinkedIn's real-world case study of migrating its authentication database—with 5B+ records—from Oracle to MySQL, achieving zero downtime and full data accuracy. It highlights technical, operational, and architectural challenges of this transition in a live environment where availability and correctness are critical. Attendees will learn about: -Challenges of migrating a high-scale login system with 5B+ records and zero downtime -Benchmarking new infrastructure for scale and latency -Safe validation, ramp-up, and cutover strategies -How AI partners with engineers to improve reliability and decision-making during complex migrations

session_name: Accessibility First: Designing Mobile Apps for Everyone
description: Millions rely on mobile apps daily—but are we truly designing for all? With the latest Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.2, inclusive design isn't optional—it's essential. Accessibility isn't just a checkbox; it's a necessity. This session bridges the knowledge gap in mobile accessibility, diving into real-world challenges and practical strategies for building inclusive apps from day one. We'll kick off with a trivia to test your accessibility awareness, then explore TalkBack and VoiceOver optimizations, color contrast, touch targets, and dynamic scaling. You'll complete a hands-on audit of your favorite app and walk away with tools, checklists, and a new mindset to prioritize accessibility. Whether you're a developer, designer, or product manager, this session equips you to create mobile experiences that don't just meet guidelines, but feel seamless and empowering for every user.

session_name: Agent squad : Learn Multi-Agent Development with Google Agent Development Kit
speaker_name(s): Abheesht Sharma, Divyashree Shivakumar Sreepathihalli, Samaneh Saadat

session_name: Break It 'Til You Make It: Building Reliability Through Testing
description: From unit tests to black-box strategies, this hands-on workshop explores how meaningful testing practices contribute to software reliability. Attendees will uncover bugs, fix flaky tests, and design effective test strategies in a collaborative learning environment.

session_name: Lighting the Bits: Making Equality of Opportunity a Reality
description: Despite increasing awareness and effort, the gender gap in science, technology, engineering, and mathematics (STEM) remains stubbornly persistent. These barriers begin early and meaningful exposure to hands-on learning and visible role models, many young girls begin to opt out of STEM pathways long before they've had the chance to explore them. In this interactive, hands-on workshop, attendees will explore how to use Micro: bits to design and deliver engaging STEM events for girls in underserved communities. Whether you are a first-time volunteer or a seasoned STEM advocate, this session will equip you with the tools, curriculum, and real-world strategies to organize impactful outreach events rooted in creative, kinesthetic learning.
speaker_name(s): Natalie Goldstein, Gauri Mishra, Lilith Matthews, Ifteda Ahmed-Syed

session_name: AI and Data for Everyone: Empowering Through Innovation
description: Democratizing AI and data is vital for empowering every level of an organization. This presentation explores strategies to make AI accessible to all, from frontline workers to leaders, showcasing the transformative power of these technologies. I will discuss integrating AI across functions to drive efficiency, and innovation. Key topics include implementing user-friendly AI tools, like Manulife's internal ChatGPT-like system, which boosts productivity and decision-making. We will examine real-world applications, such as document summarization for legal teams and underwriting tools for agents, that have enhanced business processes. Moreover, the session will highlight the importance of strategic leadership in fostering AI and data literacy, ensuring advancements benefit the entire workforce and spur growth. This presentation aims to inspire organizations to use AI and data as empowering tools, creating a more inclusive workplace.

session_name: Beyond Code: Thinking Like a User-Centric Data Scientist
description: Being a successful data scientist isn't just about coding and analytics—it's about deeply understanding your users, their needs, and crafting impactful solutions. This session will explore the critical skill of asking the right questions, developing empathy for users, and driving value by focusing less on technical complexity and more on meaningful outcomes.

session_name: Beyond the Code'd6 Navigating Leadership as a Woman in Tech
description: Breaking into tech is one challenge, but breaking through into leadership is another. For women in technology, the path to influence and leadership often requires navigating unspoken rules, systemic barriers, and internal doubts. This session explores what it really takes to grow beyond your technical contributions and step into leadership with authenticity and confidence to make an impact.

session_name: F1 to FTE: Turning Pressure into Purpose
description: As international women in tech pursuing master's degrees on F1 visas, we—Deepna and Manisha—faced immense challenges: visa stress and the fear of resume rejection. But we didn't just survive—we thrived. We secured internships that led to full-time roles at Uber Freight, navigating cultural shifts, technical hurdles, and systemic biases. In this session, we'll share our journey from F1 students to full-time engineers, revealing how we leveraged AI tools, strategic resume tactics, bold networking, and resilience to turn pressure into purpose. We'll dive into how we cracked our first tech internships, transformed them into career-defining opportunities, and why the industry needs more women like us. Attendees will leave with actionable tips to beat the ATS, impress recruiters, build their voice, and confidently navigate the job search as women in tech—dreaming big, coding hard, and staying bold.

session_name: From Fixed Frameworks to Strategic Enablers: A CIO playbook for AI Transformation
description: Abstract: Traditional architectural approaches have become unsustainable for technology leaders navigating today's AI-driven landscape. Architecture is no longer a checkpoint at the end of development but must be woven throughout the entire AI transformation lifecycle. As organizations demand more tangible evidence of AI value and competitive advantage, enterprises must fundamentally transform how they approach architecture by shifting from rigid frameworks to strategic enablement.

session_name: Mentorship That Works: No Cadence, No Problem
description: Mentorship isn't about a standing calendar invite. It's about timing and trust. In this session, two technologists from different generations share the true story of their evolving relationship built around real-time problem solving, from successfully advocating for promotions and navigating workplace dynamics to setting boundaries. A visual timeline of key touchpoints will show how impactful mentorship doesn't follow a set cadence—it's intentional. The talk will give insight into how to structure effective mentor and sponsor asks with context, clear goals, and optionality. Get practical strategies to craft "asks" that respect time, demonstrate ownership, and build long-term advocates. The experts will share how to approach candid conversations with empathy and grace when it's time to slow down or step away from a mentorship that's no longer aligned. You'll leave with a toolkit to turn professional crossroads into meaningful conversations that spark bold career moves.

session_name: OK Are You Ready to Talk About OKRs?!
description: Don't let your OKRs be MIA - unlock the power of this framework to set goals that truly deliver results! Whether you're an intern, a full-time developer, or a team lead, it can sometimes be difficult to quantify and communicate your impact. OKRs (Objectives & Key Results) are an essential tool that provides structure and clarity in helping you advocate for your contributions and excel in your role. In our presentation, we will teach you everything there is to know about OKRs and how they differ from other goal-setting frameworks. We will cover how to define an OKR, how to write a good OKR, and how to use them in your projects to measure and highlight impact to stakeholders. Setting up OKRs ahead of projects will empower you to grow into a strong, goal-oriented engineer who can showcase the full extent of the impact you create. Join us to learn how this simple yet transformative goal-setting framework can drive alignment, focus, and measurable success in your career and contributions.

session_name: Rewriting the Roadmap: Choosing Self-Care over Burnout In Tech
description: At 36, I was a staff scientist on the management track at Uber - driven, high-performing, and perpetually "on." Then came a breast cancer diagnosis that changed everything. What began as a personal health crisis forced a professional reckoning: What does success look like when your energy is finite? What happens when self-care is no longer optional, but vital? In this talk, I'll share how I worked with my employer to redesign my role - stepping off the management path, relocating, and reclaiming time and space to heal. I'll explore the emotional and cultural challenges of making that shift in an industry that often equates value with velocity and visibility. This is not a story of burnout and recovery, but about conscious tradeoffs in a digital world that rarely stops moving. I'll offer reflections and takeaways for anyone rethinking their relationship with ambition, identity, and work, especially those navigating health challenges, caregiving, or simply craving a more sane pace.

session_name: Sustainable Engineering: Building Smarter and Greener Systems at Scale
Tech Success from Within: Building Mental Resilience and Sustainable Self-Care Practices
The Data Backend of Disney+: Deep Dive on Backend Query Service White Rabbit
description: A high-level architecture overview of a backend Disney Streaming service (White Rabbit) that queries data and resolves results based on availability of the user geographically, ratings, language preferences, and more, all while holding all the data in memory with no connection to a database. The specific service is unique in that there is no database connection, yet it holds millions of unique data structures. This allows for low latency in both querying and writing data. During peak times, the service can easily handle up to 40k requests/second, with an average P99.99 of only around 97 milliseconds. Tech stack: AWS, rxJava, Kinesis, Kafka, cqEngine, Vertx

session_name: The Power of the First Step: From Remote Beginnings to Global Tech
description: This session is an honest, motivational journey of breaking into tech from unconventional beginnings. Aimed at students and early-career professionals, it focuses on building confidence, taking initiative, and finding your place in tech—even when it feels out of reach. Through personal stories, practical insights, and lessons learned, attendees will leave inspired to take their first step, embrace learning, and actively shape their career paths.

session_name: The Scenic Route to Tech: Why Detours Are a Good Thing
Unbound by Bias: Building AI That Liberates, Not Limits
description: As AI systems scale, technologists must make critical architectural decisions that influence not only model performance, but fairness, maintainability, and real-world impact. This session explores responsible AI at scale—how to design pipelines that optimize both technical excellence and ethical accountability. Attendees will learn architectural patterns for retraining loops, monitoring bias drift, and enforcing fairness constraints in distributed systems. The talk combines real production experiences with open-source tools and design tradeoffs, equipping attendees to build AI systems that scale without sidelining responsibility. Audience members will leave with the confidence to lead infrastructure decisions that impact millions, while keeping inclusion, transparency, and trust at the core of their work.
