session_name: AWS Security Jam: Gamified Learning for Cloud Security and Incident Response
description: As organizations increasingly migrate to the cloud, many professionals lack practical experience with cloud security and incident response. The AWS Security Jam offers a hands-on, team-based learning environment where participants explore real-world scenarios using AWS services. This interactive session functions like a Capture-the-Flag (CTF) challenge, with a live leaderboard to foster friendly competition. AWS provides all the infrastructure, allowing attendees to focus on solving security challenges, building their cloud skills, and collaborating with peers. By the end of the session, participants will have a deeper understanding of AWS security tools, best practices, and incident response strategies—all while networking with like-minded professionals in a gamified, risk-free environment.

session_name: Build Your First Mobile App in Under an Hour Using GenAI
description: While women are underrepresented across all fields of software engineering, the gender disparity is even greater in mobile, with under 20% of mobile engineers being women. Mobile is a valuable niche within software development, with over $520bn of mobile app revenue in 2024 and a growing demand for mobile developers, projected at 22% in this decade. Additionally, there has been a stark rise in AIi within programming, with 92% of U.S.-based developers using AI coding tools. The goal of this workshop is to help women to gain exposure to modern mobile development and inspire them to potentially pursue it as a career path. In this workshop, participants will learn how to properly utilize GenAI to assist in building a fully functioning mobile application. Participants will walk away with a fully functional mobile app that can help them plan out the conference talks they want to attend and a basic understanding of mobile development with GenAI.

session_name: Technical Interview Workshop: Recognizing and Applying Key Coding Patterns
description: Let's get ready to ace your next technical interview! In this hands-on workshop, attendees will work in groups to tackle a variety of coding problems designed to highlight essential algorithmic patterns—such as sliding window, two pointers, linked lists, merge intervals, cyclic sort, and more. Together, we'll break down each problem and practice the right strategies to identify patterns and solve them efficiently. You'll walk away with practical tools, enhanced problem-solving skills, and greater confidence to succeed in technical interviews.
speaker_name(s): Bakhyt Abisheva, Yue Ding, Sophie Ni

session_name: What caring for our environment can teach you about software performance & resource optimisation
description: As a great software engineer, you already care about performance and building resilient systems. Bringing environmental care into the mix might seem like a detour from this plan '96 but, in fact, it is a shortcut. In this hands-on workshop, you will use a development environment containing a mock system with replica services. You will apply green software principles to reduce software emissions of this system and, through guided exercises, better understand how these principles align with established software engineering design techniques. In the process, you will also learn to measure the resulting reduction in carbon emissions. By the end of the workshop, you will recognize that you do not need to be an expert in green computing to make your software more sustainable. You will walk away with a handy guide and be able to apply knowledge gained from the workshop to improve performance and utilization of resources in your organization or personal projects.

session_name: Academy or Industry? The Dilemma of an Academician Who Jumped Into a Startup Journey
description: When I graduated from the university with the degree of Computer Engineering, one thing I was 100% sure was that, one day, I was going to be a professor. I always loved research and teaching. Accordingly, I started my master's degree in Computer Science, and after that, I didn't veer the car and continued with my PhD in Computer Science. I eventually became a professor after my postdoc and have been working in academia for years. I have been always happy with this decision and I have never ever regretted this decision. This is the career I have always pursued with my all heart and full effort. But, was it the end? As a computer scientist and a research-oriented person, I was always after knowledge and tended to dig new topics deeper. As a computer engineer, I have always looked for ways to learn and integrate new technologies and create useful tools. And one day, five years ago, a question came up in my mind! Why don't I start a small start-up company? Well... the adventure began.

session_name: Boundaries are your best friend!
description: In fast-paced, always-on work environments, boundaries are often misunderstood as limitations. But in reality, they are essential tools for protecting our time, energy, and well-being. This talk reframes boundaries as a career strategy—not a constraint. Through personal storytelling and research, we'll explore the hidden costs of overcommitment, emotional labor, and the pressure to always say yes. Attendees will reflect on their personal and professional goals, learn how to set and communicate boundaries with confidence, and discover strategies to align their daily actions with long-term success. Whether you're managing a team or managing your own bandwidth, this session will help you move from burnout to balance—by recognizing that boundaries aren't barriers to success; they're the structure that makes success sustainable.

session_name: Demystifying RAG: Build a Retrieval-Augmented Generation App from Scratch
description: Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) is one of the most practical and powerful techniques in modern AI—enabling applications to pull from custom knowledge sources to generate relevant, grounded responses. In this workshop, you'll build a simple RAG pipeline from scratch using open-source tools. No prior AI experience is required—just curiosity and a laptop. By the end, you'll have a working demo and a clear understanding of how RAG works under the hood.

session_name: Designing the Future: Building Inclusive AI Through Human-Centered Thinking
description: As AI systems increasingly shape how we learn, work, and interact, ensuring these systems reflect diverse human needs is not just a technical challenge—it's a design imperative. In this talk, I'll share frameworks and actionable strategies for thinking about inclusive design in AI development, drawing from my research on human-AI interaction, content moderation, and scientific discovery tools. We'll explore how to center marginalized perspectives, mitigate bias in model development, and embed explainability and transparency into AI workflows. This session invites designers, developers, and researchers to rethink how inclusion can be baked into AI from the start—not added on later.

session_name: Ensuring development and feature rollout confidence
description: This session will cover the guardrails my team and I implemented at Uber for features with over 1 million daily users and 41 million lifetime users to date. These guardrails help ensure confident feature rollouts and ongoing monitoring. Most software engineers can attest that coding makes up only about 10% of our time. The rest is spent on tasks such as requirements gathering, testing, and monitoring. There's a lot we can do to support a feature's success—but how do we channel that effort into implementation confidence? In this session, we'll explore different types of guardrails used before and after a feature rollout. We'll discuss how these guardrails help prevent feature leaks, maintain confidence when building on top of existing features, and the tradeoffs involved when choosing between different validation strategies to guard against regressions.

session_name: Exploring Generative AI Societal Risks, AI Red Teaming, and Automation
description: Generative AI (GenAI) has quickly increased in popularity and is being incorporated into almost every domain, from healthcare to military defense. GenAI presents a unique landscape for risks and harms, and with the explosion of more capable AI applications, these risks are becoming increasingly complex and important. In this talk, we discuss how automation is necessary to make the red teaming process efficient and flexible. Automated attacks can identify risks at scale and open-source AI libraries help make these tools available to everybody as well as foster a collaborative environment for further improving the tooling and automation. By proactively identifying vulnerabilities and safety harms before products are released, we can work towards a safer AI future.

session_name: From Storytelling to Scrum: Empowering Your Transition into Tech
description: The allure of a career in tech can be undeniable, yet the perceived technical barrier often discourages individuals from non-technical backgrounds from pursuing this path. This presentation aims to demystify the transition journey and empower individuals, particularly women, to leverage their existing skills and break into the exciting world of technology. My own story embodies the power of such a transition. Growing up, Disney wasn't just a childhood icon, it was a symbol of creativity and storytelling. It was a dream come true when I landed a position at the company. However, my journey took an unexpected turn when I discovered a passion for problem-solving and the potential to utilize technology to translate stories into interactive experiences. Despite lacking a formal background in coding or tech-specific skills, I embarked on a journey of self-discovery and upskilling, successfully transitioning into the dynamic field of product management.

session_name: Getting Started with GraphQL: Build Smarter APIs
description: GraphQL is revolutionizing the way developers build and consume APIs, no more over-fetching or juggling multiple endpoints. In this fast-paced, beginner-friendly workshop, attendees will build and query their very first GraphQL API using JavaScript and Apollo Server. We'll start with the basics: what GraphQL is, how it compares to REST, and why it's gaining so much momentum in modern web development. Then, participants will follow along in a live coding session where they'll define types, write resolvers, and test their API using GraphQL Playground. By the end of the hour, they'll have a working project they can build on and the confidence to use GraphQL in their own applications. Whether you're a frontend developer seeking to overcome REST limitations or a backend engineer exploring modern API architectures, this workshop is your gateway to GraphQL.

session_name: Invisible Engineers: Why Data Infrastructure Deserves a Seat at the Product Table
description: This presentation focuses on highlighting the impact of data engineers and discussing ways to draw visibility to the work done by them.

session_name: Lakehouse: One Stop Shop for all your Data
description: We present a deep dive of Legend Lakehouse - Goldman Sachs' cloud-native solution to securely store & access firm's analytical data. Lakehouse is integrated with the Goldman Sachs open -source Legend data platform. We will briefly describe existing pain points with data & how Lakehouse addresses them. We will present Lakehouse architecture & discuss interesting design choices such as use of Iceberg open table format to provide interoperability across multiple query engines. Lastly, we will demonstrate an end-to-end workflow of how a quantitative strategist can use Legend Lakehouse to ingest, experiment with, and analyze a sample dataset, illustrating Lakehouse's intuitive access control mechanisms & integrated data quality controls. Attendees will learn cloud storage concepts, how to ingest data to the cloud & different query mechanisms. They will glean how data storage is managed at a platform level for multiple user personas & understand product development process of Goldman Sachs.

session_name: Mastering Data Collection Pipelines: How to Build Resilient Event-Driven Architectures
description: Modern applications generate massive amounts of data that need to be ingested, processed, and stored efficiently to power real-time insights and analytics. Yet building scalable, resilient data collection pipelines remains a major challenge for many organizations. This session will demystify the design of robust event-driven data pipelines capable of handling billions of events reliably. We'll cover event sourcing principles, idempotency, retry mechanisms, failure handling, and building fault-tolerant ingestion architectures using tools like Kafka, Spark, and Delta Lake. Through real-world examples, attendees will learn to identify common failure points and design around them. Whether you are building pipelines for analytics, AI, or customer personalization, this session will equip you with the architectural foundations needed to design data pipelines that scale gracefully, deliver quality data downstream, and support evolving business needs without compromising performance or trust.

session_name: MLOps with Kubeflow: Scalable Model Deployment on Kubernetes
description: In this hands-on session, we'll take a machine learning model from a Jupiter notebook to a fully managed, automated MLOps pipeline using Kubeflow on Kubernetes. You'll learn how to orchestrate training workflows, deploy scalable model-serving endpoints, and monitor performance — all inside a Kubernetes-native ecosystem. Perfect for ML engineers, DevOps pros, and data scientists looking to productionize their models the right way.

session_name: Multi modal Databases and simplified application development
description: Analysis shows multimodal databases reduce development time by 40-60% while improving cross-modal query performance by up to 300%. Applications include content recommendation systems, medical diagnostics integrating patient records with imaging, and IoT platforms combining sensor data with multimedia content. As data types diversify, multimodal databases become essential for efficient application development.

session_name: Navigating the Maze: Extracting and Analyzing Forensic Artifacts in Containerized Environments
description: As organizations increasingly adopt containerization technologies like Docker and Kubernetes to streamline application deployment, the forensic landscape is evolving rapidly. Containerized environments present unique challenges for digital forensic investigators due to their ephemeral nature, complex networking setups, and distributed architecture. This presentation aims to shed light on the intricacies of conducting forensic investigations in containerized environments and provide practical strategies for extracting and analyzing forensic artifacts. In this session, we will delve into the world of containerized environments and explore the key challenges faced by digital forensic investigators. Attendees will gain insights into the lifecycle of containers, from deployment to termination, and understand how this dynamic environment impacts forensic analysis.

session_name: Scaling Data Enrichment with LLMs: A Hands-on Workshop
description: Master the implementation of Large Language Models (LLMs) for efficient offline data enrichment. This workshop addresses the growing need for efficient LLM implementation in data processing workflows. Many organizations struggle with scaling LLM solutions, managing costs, and maintaining consistent quality in batch processing. Drawing from production experience at Amazon AGI, this workshop provides hands-on strategies for building robust LLM systems. Participants will learn to overcome common challenges in model selection, prompt engineering, and infrastructure scaling while implementing practical solutions for real-world data enrichment scenarios. Through hands-on exercises, you will build a production-ready LLM pipeline handling real-world data enrichment scenarios. Learn to enhance customer data, augment product information, and automate complex classification tasks.

session_name: Software Developer, Product Manager, And Sometimes Both At The Same Time
description: The proposed session is on guiding participants through transitioning to their desired career role. Through activities like SWOT analysis, competency matrix, and attendees identify transferable skills, bridge gaps, and prepare for their transition. With solo reflection and group discussions, they craft resumes, practice interviews, and brainstorm networking strategies. Attendees leave with actionable plans and confidence to navigate their career transition effectively. This workshop equips them with tools and resources to pursue meaningful opportunities aligned with their aspirations.

session_name: Unifying QA and DevOps: A Leadership Blueprint for Continuous Quality
description: This session explores how I led the unification of QA and DevOps at Morningstar, transforming siloed teams into a cohesive, high-impact engineering function. By challenging long-standing assumptions, we redefined how quality and delivery coexist, treating them not as a separate goal but as a shared discipline. Through thoughtful automation, modern CI/CD strategies, and the targeted use of AI-driven tools, we evolved from quarterly releases to a model of frequent, high-integrity delivery, maintaining compliance while improving reliability, speed, and customer confidence. Attendees will learn to identify and dismantle systemic friction points with lean, strategic changes. I'll share how we evolved our engineering culture to increase ownership, deepen accountability, and reframe our role around continuous value creation. Whether you're a developer or a director, this session offers a blueprint for integrated, resilient engineering.

session_name: Unleash Your Voice: Selling Ideas with Conviction & Impact
description: Are you feeling unheard or unseen? Struggling to influence much needed change within your organization? Unsure how to navigate office politics and ensure your ideas appeal to your peers/leaders? You're not alone! Early career professionals are often susceptible to falling victim to their own self-doubt and struggle to capture the attention of their audience — leaders, peers, and partners. Tailoring ideas to the audience's passions and presenting with conviction are critical to obtaining buy-in and influencing change within an organization. During this session, we'll cover strategies for articulating complex concepts clearly, anticipating and navigating objections, and presenting with confidence. Empower yourself to advocate for your innovations and build a reputation as a rising leader/influencer early in your career!

session_name: Women Shaping Wearables: Creating Cutting-Edge AI Technology
speaker_name(s): Julia Levy, Hind Hobeika, Michelle Pujals, Ming Hua, Kelly Ingham

session_name: AI-Crafted Resumes: Build a Winning Resume Using Prompt Engineering
description: Stand out in today's job market with AI-powered resumes! In this engaging session, learn how to use Generative AI and prompt engineering to craft role-specific, ATS-optimized resumes. We'll walk through extracting keywords from job posts, generating customized resumes using tools like OpenAI and Gemini, scoring resume-job fit, and leveraging compensation insights from platforms like levels.fyi or Glassdoor. Whether you're a job seeker, coach, or recruiter, this hands-on demo will equip you with tools to create high-impact resumes, assess your fit for roles, and confidently negotiate offers—turning AI into your career advantage.

session_name: AI-Driven Endpoint Privilege Management: Reducing Attack Surfaces in the Modern Enterprise
description: As cyber threats grow in sophistication, even well-protected networks remain vulnerable when user privileges are excessive or poorly managed. In this session, you'll learn how combining least-privilege principles with AI-powered threat detection can transform your security posture. We'll cover: Why privilege management matters: How over-privileged accounts become targets for lateral movement and ransomware Applying least-privilege frameworks: Strategies for auditing, enforcing, and automating privilege reduction across endpoints AI in security operations: Real-time anomaly detection, predictive risk scoring, and dynamic policy enforcement Data-driven reporting: Using dashboards and analytics to prove compliance and measure risk reduction Attendees will leave with an actionable plan to integrate endpoint privilege management and AI tools—empowering teams to detect and stop threats before they spread.

session_name: Building for Uptime: Backend Reliability in Uber'eds Architecture
description: Reliability at Uber is designed into the architecture—not bolted on later. In this talk, I'll share how backend engineers at Uber build for uptime across systems that power trip flows, fares, and real-time user experiences. We'll cover how we approach multi-region infrastructure, service tiering, failover planning, and high-scale resilience. You'll learn how architectural decisions like dependency isolation, deployment sequencing, and capacity planning contribute to our reliability goals. Whether it's traffic surges during global events or handling cascading failures across services, this session provides practical strategies for building dependable systems that support millions of users, every day.

session_name: Curious, not Confused: How You Can Make Technical Discovery Your Product Superpower
description: It's a Bird, It's a Plane, It's'85 a PM? Even if you do not see yourself as technical, technical discovery can be your superpower. What do you do when the problem is buried in platform code, the proposed solution sounds like developer magic, and stakeholders want clarity on impact? This talk offers practical tools for product managers and engineers to lead discovery and communicate impact in complex systems, from app infrastructure to user-facing experiences. Whether you are exploring tech debt work, aligning on architecture, or uncovering new levers for customer experience, you will learn how to frame tradeoffs, ask better questions, and create forward motion, without needing all the answers.

session_name: Engineering Uber'eds Next-Gen Payments Platform: Reliability, Scale, and Global Reach
description: This abstract describes a session focused on Uber's next-generation global payments platform. It highlights the system's massive operational scale, including approximately 120 million daily financial transactions and support for 34 million daily trips (as of Q1 2025) across more than 70 countries and 15,000 cities. The abstract will delve into the engineering ingenuity, architectural principles, and specific design choices behind this platform, all aimed at achieving robust reliability, extensive scalability, and adherence to global financial compliance standards for Uber's diverse payment needs.

session_name: From Zero to Petabytes: 5 Patterns and Top 10 Architectures for Resilient Real-Data-Intensive System
description: Data is the core of every modern application—but designing systems that process, store, and move data at scale is hard. This session distills key principles from data-intensive architecture design. We'll explore consistency trade-offs (CAP theorem), replication strategies, distributed consensus, and storage engines. Through case studies involving messaging systems, analytics platforms, and real-time apps, we'll unpack patterns like event sourcing, write-ahead logs, materialized views, and caching. Whether you're building from scratch or evolving an architecture, you'll leave with clarity on how to design robust, scalable, and future-ready data systems.

session_name: Intelligence Unbound: Foundation ML Models revolutionizing Technology
My Secret Weapon at Work: How I Use ChatGPT to Think, Write, and Lead Better
description: Everyone is talking about AI replacing jobs, but what if you could use it to excel at yours? In this talk, I share how I use ChatGPT as my secret weapon to perform at the next level in a senior technical role. From debugging machine learning experiments and brainstorming new product features to summarizing research papers and preparing for high-stakes presentations, ChatGPT is part of my weekly workflow. It helps me think more clearly, write more effectively, and lead with confidence. This session goes beyond the hype and shows how to practically embed generative AI into your daily routine. You will walk away with prompt templates, productivity systems, and new ways to use AI not just to work faster, but to improve your thinking and communication. Whether you're mid-career or already senior, you'll leave with tools and ideas to integrate ChatGPT into your growth journey.

session_name: Powering Billions: How Uber Scales Real-Time Financial Transactions
description: What does it take to process over 56 million trips and 1.5 billion financial transactions a day — and still close the books on time? In this high-energy session, go under the hood of Uber's Finance Computation Platform (FCP), the powerful backend engine that translates global trip data into accurate, auditable financial records at scale. Learn how event-driven architecture and fault-tolerant systems come together to power real-time accounting in one of the world's most complex and dynamic marketplaces. If you've ever wondered how tech meets finance at scale — this is your deep dive.

session_name: Putting the Sand in Sandbox: Fostering Tech Careers in Puerto Rico
description: What if cutting-edge AI agents and software solutions were built, far from usual tech hubs, on the shores of Puerto Rico? Xtillion shares how our engineers, either returning home or discovering one, are creating world-class tech through skill-development opportunities, internal product incubators, and purpose-driven work. Whether you're returning, rebuilding, or just reimagining where your path could go, this is a blueprint for building boldly—wherever you choose to bloom.

session_name: Revolutionizing Software Development: From Vibe Coding to Prompt Driven Development
description: Explore the revolutionary shift in software development as we dive into emerging paradigms: Vibe Coding and Prompt Driven Development. Discover how these approaches are transforming traditional coding practices by leveraging AI pair programming. Learn practical strategies for effective prompt crafting, understanding AI capabilities, and maintaining code quality while significantly accelerating development velocity. Through real-world examples and hands-on demonstrations, understand how to adapt your development workflow for the AI-augmented future. Drawing from our extensive experience at Amazon AGI, we'll examine when and how to effectively use each approach, their strengths and limitations, and best practices for maintaining code quality.

session_name: Scaling AI-Driven Quality Control: Lessons from Monitoring 800K+ Financial Assets Daily
description: How do you ensure quality and reliability across 800,000+ investment data points processed every day? This session explores a real-world AI deployment at Morningstar that modernized anomaly detection in financial data pipelines. Using a multi-layer framework, the system integrates scalable data processing, LSTM-based real-time monitoring, expert-in-the-loop feedback, and dependency-aware alerting to minimize false positives while enhancing trust and reliability. Attendees will learn how to architect AI-driven quality control that balances automation with explainability, leverages human judgment for better accuracy, and maintains compliance in highly regulated environments. This talk provides practical insights for technologists seeking to integrate AI into complex production workflows without compromising data integrity or operational confidence.

session_name: Smart Money: Financial Literacy and Goal-Based Planning in the Age of AI
description: In a world where AI powers investment platforms, robo-advisors suggest portfolios, and fintech apps claim to make you rich, how do you take control of your financial future? This session offers a grounded, tech-aware guide to personal finance for the modern professional. We'll break down the fundamentals of goal-based financial planning, explain key investing principles (risk, diversification, compounding), and explore how AI tools can empower—or mislead—your financial decisions. You'll learn: '95tHow to define and prioritize your financial goals '95tThe basics of investing: asset classes, risk tolerance, and common mistakes '95tHow to evaluate AI-driven financial tools—and use them wisely '95tThe difference between being "money busy" and "money smart" Whether you're saving for a home, planning a sabbatical, or just trying to break the paycheck-to-paycheck cycle, this talk delivers a no-fluff roadmap to build confidence and clarity with money, backed by data and behavioral insights

session_name: The PM in the Machine: Building Human-Centered Products in the Age of AI
description: AI is changing how we build—but it shouldn't change why we build. In this talk, I'll share how product leaders can shape the future of AI by grounding innovation in user needs, ethics, and clarity. I'll cover practical lessons from leading Generative AI strategy at Uber, including how to align cross-functional teams, translate complexity into value, and avoid building tech for tech's sake. Whether you're a PM, engineer, or designer, you'll leave with tools to lead AI efforts that are as responsible as they are revolutionary.

session_name: uber Chaos to Clarity - Lighting Up Your Logs
description: Imagine your log files as an endless group chat—messages flying everywhere, and you're hunting for the important tea. At Uber, our Airport Live Observability system turned the chaos of millions of logged messages into calm with Kafka and Grafana. In this talk, you'll: Tame the Gossip: See how a unified Kafka consumer corrals millions of events in real time. Filter the Noise: Enrich and route logs so only critical signals get through. Stage the Highlights: Build Grafana dashboards with templates, thresholds, and alerts that spotlight real issues. Win the Speed Race: Apply three quick tweaks—index tuning, dynamic alerts, and panel grouping—to slash debugging time by 20%. Packed with witty stories, clear diagrams, and live demos (no Kafka or Grafana experience needed), you'll leave with a battle-tested blueprint to turn any log-stream meltdown into a five-star operation. Come for the laughs, stay for the insights!

session_name: AI Agentic Masterclass: Multi-Agent System Development with LangGraph, Memory & HIL
description: Are you eager to do a deep dive into the practical aspects of constructing intelligent multi-agent AI systems? This immersive session with practical insights offers participants the opportunity to gain familiarity and experience with LangGraph, the framework designed for orchestrating complex multi-agent workflows. Through structured content, attendees will learn to implement crucial agent capabilities, including both short-term conversational context and long-term knowledge persistence. The session will also cover the integration of human-in-the-loop mechanisms to enhance control and safety within agentic systems. By the conclusion of this masterclass, participants will acquire the practical skills and confidence necessary to design, deploy, and evaluate production-ready multi-Agent system end-to-end. The session is structured to facilitate the transition from theoretical understanding to tangible end-to-end AI Agent development.

session_name: Beyond the Box: How Strategic Team Switches Unbind Careers and Systems
description: After over three years at Pinterest and Uber, we each made a bold move: switching teams within our companies. Though we live and work in different countries, we were driven by similar motivations: burnout, curiosity, and a desire to gain new perspectives without leaving our organizations. In this session, we'll share how we approached these transitions, the challenges we faced, and what we learned about ourselves, our careers, and the systems we work on. From stepping into unfamiliar domains to rebuilding technical credibility and adjusting to new team dynamics, we'll reflect on the personal and professional growth that followed. We'll also explore the ripple effects of these changes, from refreshed energy in codebases to stronger cross-functional collaboration, and offer practical strategies for engineers and leaders looking to evolve without starting over.

session_name: Certifications as Confidence Catalysts: Conquering Impostor Syndrome in Tech
description: Navigating a career in technology—whether breaking in or leveling up—often feels like a high-stakes journey fraught with self-doubt. For many, particularly women and underrepresented minorities, impostor syndrome is a persistent barrier, casting doubt on skills and worth, especially when tackling new roles or technologies. This session reimagines industry certifications—not just as technical credentials, but as powerful tools for building confidence and combating self-doubt. In this talk, we'll explore how certifications in areas like cloud, security, and networking provide structure, validation, and visibility in your tech journey. More than just resume boosters, certifications act as a psychological reset, offering tangible proof of expertise and a renewed sense of purpose. Through a blend of personal storytelling, practical strategies, and actionable insights, attendees will leave empowered to use certifications to unlock both external opportunities and internal confidence.

session_name: Decoding the Human Element in CyberSecurity: Innovative Strategies for Combating Insider Threats
description: Insider threats, whether driven by malice or human error, are becoming increasingly sophisticated and harder to detect. This session explores the nuanced spectrum of insider threats, from accidental data exposure to deliberate sabotage, and presents innovative strategies to address them. We'll delve into the AI-powered user behavioral analytics systems that help detect anomalous patterns, as well as techniques for hardening initial access and curbing lateral movement. The session will spotlight how Uber is implementing a zero-trust security model to proactively identify and mitigate internal risks before they lead to major incidents.

session_name: Digital Empathy: How AI Is Transforming Mental Health and Emotional Wellness for Aging Populations
description: By 2050, more than 2 billion people globally will be over the age of 60. This demographic shift is not just a statistical milestone—it represents a profound transformation in how we must approach mental health, emotional wellness, and care delivery for aging populations. With older adults facing rising rates of loneliness, cognitive decline, and limited access to consistent emotional support, the urgency for innovative, scalable solutions is greater than ever. This session explores how emerging technologies—particularly AI—can be leveraged to meet these needs with dignity, empathy, and care. It focuses on the role of emotionally intelligent AI in supporting mental health and enabling proactive self-care among seniors, while offering design and ethical insights applicable across populations.

session_name: Freshman to Full-Time: Internships, Research Publications and the SWE Roadmap
description: Landing your first software engineering internship can feel like a long shot—but it's absolutely possible with the right strategy. This session breaks down a practical, step-by-step roadmap to help college students stand out early. Attendees will learn how to build a compelling resume with limited experience, leverage personal projects and GitHub, network effectively (even without connections), and navigate career fairs and online applications with confidence. We'll also cover how to identify freshman-friendly opportunities, tailor outreach messages, and how to prepare for technical interviews. Whether you're just starting out or already applying, this session will equip you with actionable tools, tips, and a mindset shift to help you land that first offer—sooner than you think.

session_name: From Code to Strategy: Transitioning from Software Engineer to Product Manager
description: Curious about Product Management but unsure how to make the leap from Software Engineering? In this practical and empowering session, a former Microsoft software engineer—now a thriving PM at Microsoft—shares the real-world playbook for a successful transition. Learn the skills that matter, the mindset shifts required, and the honest truth about what works (and what doesn't). Whether you're exploring new career paths or ready to make the move, you'll walk away with actionable tips, insider insights, and a framework to evaluate if PM is right for you—and how to break in if it is.

session_name: Mentoring Circles that Matter: Building Inclusive Communities of Growth
description: Mentoring circles are more than a buzzword—they are a powerful, scalable model for fostering inclusion, leadership, and community in tech. This session will explore how to design, launch, and sustain mentoring circles that truly make a difference. Whether you're starting from scratch or looking to revitalize an existing program, you'll leave with a blueprint for building inclusive spaces where growth is mutual and leadership is shared.

session_name: Mind the Gap: Bridging AI Power with Human Perspective
description: "Aren't you afraid AI will take your job?" It's a common question often based on a misunderstanding of what AI can and can't do. This fear fuels the misconception that data roles are easily replaced. In reality, data teams should see AI as a lever to amplify their impact. From our experience building AI workflows and guiding adoption, we've found that successful implementation depends on context—and that context comes from human understanding of systems and processes. While AI excels at automating repetitive tasks, it's human judgment that ensures solutions are applied meaningfully. As a result, the nature of work evolves: data teams shift from execution to strategy, bringing insight AI alone can't replicate. This session will explore how to design human-in-the-loop AI workflows that empower rather than replace, enabling teams to work smarter. We'll share lessons from 13 months of building and scaling AI solutions at West Monroe—and our take on AI's impact on developer roles.

session_name: Remote but Not Alone: Implementing the IGLOO Framework in Remote Work Environments
description: The widespread adoption of remote work has revealed an emerging crisis in workforce mental health, with 64% of executives surveyed by the Integrated Benefits Institute (IBI) indicating remote work negatively impact their employees' mental health. This session examines how the empirically validated IGLOO framework (1) can be systematically applied to address the mounting mental health crisis in remote work environments. Through analysis of implementation across varied organizational contexts, we demonstrate how this five-level intervention approach - Individual, Group, Leader, Organization, and Outside - creates a comprehensive support structure for remote worker wellbeing.

session_name: Science + Comedy: Finding Joyful Solutions to Serious Problems
description: What happens when sharp scientific thinking meets the art of laughter? In this engaging and unconventional session, explore how humor can spark creativity, break down complex ideas, and inspire innovative problem-solving. Scientist and Comedian Sophie Shrand will use storytelling and satire to tackle pressing global challenges, this conversation reveals how joy and curiosity can coexist with rigor and impact. Discover how embracing playfulness can open new pathways to collaboration, communication, and breakthrough solutions—because sometimes, the smartest way to solve serious problems starts with a smile.

session_name: The AI Product Lifecycle 'f1 Navigating from Ideation to Execution
description: This session offers a practical and structured approach to navigating the full AI/ML product lifecycle—from identifying the right problems to solving with AI, to building responsible and scalable solutions, to ensuring programmatic support for long-term success. This session also provides a framework that emphasizes strategic evaluation, collaborative execution, and adaptable program management. Designed for product and program managers, this session equips attendees with actionable strategies to deliver high-impact AI/ML products responsibly and effectively.

session_name: The Founder'eds Table: How We Built AI Empires from the Ground Up
description: Why join a seat at someone else's table when you can build your own? In this talk, learn from two leaders on how they built thriving AI communities. - Maryam Farooq who is the founder & director of New York Artificial Intelligence (NYAI), a global community of over 10k AI builders, founders, and investors since 2016. - Melissa Barr who is the organizer and lead for the NYC chapter of Women in Machine Learning and Data Science (WiMLDS), relaunching it into a 5k-member powerhouse with a 10-woman board. We'll walk through the exact steps we took, from forming a mission, structuring leadership teams, and recruiting talent, to building partnerships, hosting impactful events, educating the community and sustaining long-term momentum. Whether you want to start a local chapter or launch the next global tech organization, this duo talk will equip you with the blueprint, real-world examples, and confidence to build your own AI community. Let's build your empire together!

session_name: The Gen Z Tech Stack for IoT: GenAI & WebAssembly at the Edge
description: The future of IoT isn't in the cloud—it's at the edge, inside your wristwatch, your factory line, or a crop field 500 miles from the nearest datacenter. Welcome to the Gen Z tech stack: where Generative AI meets Web Assembly to power a new generation of intelligent, secure, and lightning-fast edge applications.

session_name: Trim the Fat: Build Lean, Sustainable Data Pipelines
description: Join us to explore the top strategies for building data pipelines that are efficient, cost-effective, and environmentally responsible. You'll learn how intermittent and autoscaling designs, cloud-native tools, and smart storage choices can reduce your pipeline's carbon footprint. Sam Altman's remark that "Please" and "Thank You" to ChatGPT waste millions in compute power is a reminder that every inefficiency, no matter how small, adds up at scale. This session will show you how to optimize every step—because in the world of data, efficiency is sustainability.

session_name: Trusting the Invisible Pilot in the Evolution of Autonomy in Tech
description: Autonomy has been part of our world far longer than most people realize. From the first airplane autopilot to today's intelligent systems, invisible pilots have quietly shaped the way we travel, explore, and interact with technology. We see them in planes, cars, space missions, and even in everyday tools but as machines take on more decisions, the real challenge isn't just what they can do, it's whether we can trust them. Learning Objectives u003culu003e tu003cliu003eTrace the journey of autonomy from early aviation autopilots to today's cross-industry systems.u003c/liu003e tu003cliu003eUnderstand why trust between people and autonomous systems is so critical.u003c/liu003e tu003cliu003eLook at the ethical and safety challenges that come with designing autonomy.u003c/liu003e tu003cliu003eEncourage attendees to bring responsibility and transparency into the future of autonomous design.u003c/liu003e u003c/ulu003e

session_name: Unbound by Fear: Thriving in Threat Intelligence Through Curiosity, Chaos, and Community
description: This talk would focus on my lived experience being a manager in the Microsoft Threat Intelligence Center (MSTIC) - navigating steep learning curves, onboarding during chaotic periods, and supporting others. Through my story I will provide techniques to operate in any environment unbound by fear or uncertainty.

session_name: Voice in the Noise: Influencing AI Product Teams with Insight, Empathy, and Strategic Research
description: In today's fast-paced, AI-driven tech world, product teams often chase quick wins—leaving little to no time for a deep, shared understanding of the user. This talk is for researchers, designers, engineers, PMs, and cross-functional partners who want to lead with clarity and impact—regardless of role or title. I'll share lessons from leading UX research for Microsoft Teams Calling and AI features, and previously at Cisco Webex, to show how insights can shape strategy—even without formal authority. I'll reflect on my journey from being the quietest person in the room to confidently influencing roadmaps, advocating for inclusion, and collaborating across disciplines. Attendees will walk away with practical strategies to build trust, embed research into decision-making, and amplify their voice on any team. Whether you're early in your career or growing your influence, this session will equip you to lead from wherever you are.

session_name: Your Docs Are Your Superpower Use Them to Get Seen and Promoted
Crash-Proof Code with Erlang: A Hands-On Introduction
From Pull Requests to People Problems: Making the Leap to Manager
description: You were great at your job'85 so they gave you a new one. Welcome to management — where the problems are fuzzier, the wins are harder to measure, and no one really explains how to do the job. This workshop is for anyone who's newly made the leap (or thinking about it) and wants the real talk about what it means to shift from doing the work to enabling others to do it. We'll dive into the emotional rollercoaster of people management, the awkward art of giving feedback, and the juggling act of prioritization. Through hands-on scenarios, small-group reflection, and shared war stories, you'll leave with tools, insights, and a little more confidence that yes, you can lead — even if it feels like chaos sometimes.

session_name: Messaging Magic at Disney Using AI and AWS
description: Discover Messaging Magic at Disney Using AWS Technologies and AI Coding Assistant! This workshop covers building a large-scale messaging system using AWS tools like Lambda, DynamoDB, DynamoDB Streams, and Kinesis. Learn AWS IAM permissions, roles, and use Amazon Q for code generation and debugging. Gain hands-on experience deploying Lambda functions via AWS console and Terraform, testing with DynamoDB triggers, and using CloudWatch for monitoring and logging. Designed for programmers with basic AWS knowledge, this workshop provides practical skills for real-world AWS implementations.

session_name: Advancing Eldercare with AI: Intelligent Companions and Human-Centered Systems
description: By 2050, over 2 billion people globally will be aged 60+, sharply increasing the need for innovative solutions to address loneliness, mental health, cognitive decline and compassionate caregiving. There is a need to empower and enrich the lives of seniors. This engaging session highlights cutting-edge digital game designs and intuitive adaptive interfaces, illustrating how practical and thoughtful technology can profoundly improve elderly care. Leveraging in-depth research, pilot studies, and strategic insights, attendees will discover practical AI implementations that foster emotional connections, cognitive enrichment, and greater independence for seniors. The presentation will highlight: 1. Why AI is a force for Social Good 2. AI Companions and Mental Health Solutions for emotional support and stress reduction 3. Innovative Game-Based Experiences for cognitive simulation 4. Hyper personalized Legacy keeper - Storytelling across generations 5. Building Trust: Ethical & Inclusive AI

session_name: Artificial Intelligence in Open-Source Project Management
description: As artificial intelligence continues to evolve, there is a growing need for project maintainers to leverage on AI to foster diverse and inclusive collaborations. In this session, I will discuss the importance of artificial intelligence in open-source project management, actionable strategies to maximize diverse talents and promote transparency, tools and technologies available for project maintainers, and practical ways to leverage these technologies to make a meaningful impact within open-source communities.

session_name: Balancing Self Care and Productivity while Working from Home
description: In today's career landscape, many companies are encouraging employees to work in the environment that they thrive in - whether that is working from home, hybrid work, or full-time in the office. While working from home is a flexible option that many enjoy, it's not always easy. The difficulties of maintaining focus while in a potentially distracting environment, creating and sticking to a schedule, and keeping a work-life balance are only some of the things to consider and tackle while working from home. In this presentation, we'll be going over our own journeys working from home, skills we've developed, and resources that people may be able to generalize to their own work.

session_name: Behind the Brand: Women Founders Tell All
description: Building a brand takes vision, resilience, and a willingness to share your truth. In this candid panel discussion, successful women founders pull back the curtain on their entrepreneurial journeys—the wins, the setbacks, and the lessons learned along the way. Hear from a panel of trailblazers who built their brands from the ground up, navigated challenges, cultivated loyal audiences, and stayed authentic through growth and change. From defining your brand's purpose to leading with impact, this conversation offers real talk and actionable insights for anyone ready to turn an idea into a lasting legacy.
speaker_name(s): Tony Wilkins, Sophie Shrand, Christine Izuakor, Amanda Lannert

session_name: Democratizing Math: Duolingo's Journey to Unlock STEM Access for Every Learner using AI
description: Math confidence is the strongest early predictor of who pursues, and stays, in technical careers, yet women remain drastically under-represented in advanced math pathways. At Duolingo we asked: "What if the same playful, mobile-first magic that opened doors to language could also open doors to calculus?" This session recounts our quest to teach the entire K-12+ math continuum (in free, bite-sized, and globally scalable lessons) by pairing learning-science craft with the rapid evolution of large language models. You'll hear inside stories of setbacks (LLMs that "hallucinated" fractions), breakthroughs (grading at scale without bias), and the product principles that kept us shipping. Expect an honest look at data-driven iteration, the ethics of equitable AI, and why putting more women at the whiteboard (both as builders and as learners!) changes outcomes for the next generation of technologists.

session_name: From Breaks to Breakthroughs: My 17-Year Journey in Tech, Family, and Growth
description: This talk shares my unconventional 17-year journey as a woman in tech in India. I began my career at HP/HPE, driven by curiosity and passion for engineering. While working full-time, I pursued a part-time master's degree, balancing early marriage and a growing career. Motherhood brought new challenges, and I took a 5.5-year break to support my child's speech and language needs. During this time, I relocated to my hometown, enrolled in a PhD program, and completed 75 Coursera courses using a student license—an effort featured in a top Indian magazine. With strong family support, I returned to my previous company and later secured a remote role at Microsoft. This is a story of resilience, reinvention, and the quiet strength of women who adapt and thrive. Key Takeaways: * How to navigate career breaks with purpose and preparation * Staying technically relevant through online learning * Enabling inclusive careers through remote work * The role of family and self-belief in long-term success

session_name: From Handshakes to Opportunities: Mastering Networking in Tech
description: Networking is a cornerstone of career success in tech, yet it can feel daunting, especially for women and underrepresented groups navigating a competitive industry. The session will provide statistics and data about the gender challenges and provide pro tips for overcoming gender challenges. At large industry gatherings where thousands of tech professionals converge, the opportunity to build meaningful connections is unparalleled—but only if you know how to approach it. This session equips attendees with practical, inclusive strategies to network with purpose, fostering authentic relationships that open doors to mentorship, collaboration, and career growth. We'll explore how to prepare for networking events, initiate conversations with confidence, and follow up effectively to sustain connections.

session_name: From Intern to Senior Engineer: Lessons That Actually Helped Me Grow
description: This session shares the real, lived experience of growing from an overwhelmed intern to a confident senior engineer, while navigating the pressures of being a woman and immigrant in tech. Designed for early to mid-career engineers, it explores the mindset shifts and strategies that helped the speaker overcome self-doubt, burnout, and invisible career roadblocks. From asking better questions to advocating for promotion and setting boundaries, attendees will hear pivotal moments that shaped real growth. Through honest stories and actionable advice, the talk highlights how success isn't linear—and offers practical tools and reflection prompts for anyone navigating their own path in tech.

session_name: From Lost to Leveled Up: Cracking Big Codebases with Confidence
description: Feeling overwhelmed by a massive codebase? You're not alone. Whether you're joining your first team or switching projects, understanding a large, complex system as a software engineer can feel like a black box. In this session, we'll share a practical, step-by-step approach to navigating unfamiliar code with confidence, drawn from our experiences at Uber. You'll learn how to start with the product vision, map directories to functionality, identify key elements, and use modern AI-based tools like Cursor to speed up exploration and understanding. Mastering the skill of diving into a new codebase will accelerate your career growth by reducing ramp-up time, improving autonomy, and helping you make meaningful impact faster. If you've ever opened a repo and thought, "Where do I even start?", then this session is for you. Don't worry, we've all been there. You don't need to understand the whole codebase, just enough to make it yours.

session_name: From Reactive to Proactive: Building a Security Flywheel for Modern Organizations
Like Father, Like Daughter: From Floppy Disks to Cloud Tricks'f350 Years of Tech Tales and Girl Power
description: This is the multi-generation tale of a father and daughter who share their learnings of over 50 collective years in the technology industry. Jos'e9 Frietze recently retired from a 40-year career, which started as a Product Service Engineer at Hewlett Packard and retired as a Solutions Engineer at Keysight Technologies. With no intention of following in her dad's footsteps into what she understood as a child to be "working with computers", Sara landed a role as a finance manager for a product at Microsoft called Azure. Fast forward to today, this father and daughter realized they share very similar experiences, frustrations and learnings through their career journeys in the tech industry. Learn from over 50 years of experience how to succeed as a minority and as a woman in tech while uplifting those around you.

session_name: Securing On-premises, Cloud and Edge Infrastructure leveraging AI
description: Artificial Intelligence (AI) has become a cornerstone of modern cybersecurity, revolutionizing how organizations secure core infrastructure across on-premises, cloud, and edge environments. This presentation aims to discuss challenges in each of these areas, along with AI-driven security strategies and specific AI technologies available to address them. We will review several use cases to provide insight into best practices in industries. Additionally, we will examine the security measures needed to protect AI-generated content and systems from malicious attacks, as well as the necessity of safeguarding the AI technologies themselves from such threats.

session_name: Small Actions, Big Impact: The Power of Purpose-Driven Tech
description: Small actions can drive big change. Hear from Savannah, Senior Impact Partnerships Manager, as she explains how technology is transforming the way brands and consumers give back. Discover how integrating purpose-driven solutions are revolutionizing financial technology, seamlessly embedding donations into payments and empowering millions to support causes with a single click. Join us to learn how technology can turn everyday transactions into lasting change.

session_name: The Complete Package: Traversing multi-decade career as a woman leader
The Unbusy Path: Reclaiming Time, Energy, and Purpose in Tech
Excelling in Product Management in the Era of Agents
description: In the rapidly evolving landscape of product management, the integration of Agents and AI-driven tools is transforming how products are conceived, developed, and delivered. This panel will explore the best tools and practices that product managers can leverage to stay relevant and excel in their roles. We will delve into the importance of building user-centric products, focusing on user empathy, and solving real user problems. Join us for an insightful discussion with industry experts who will share their experiences, strategies, and actionable insights to help you navigate the complexities of modern product management. While some panelists may advocate for the extensive use of AI tools to streamline processes and enhance decision-making, others might emphasize the need for a balanced approach that combines technology with human intuition.
